pli-tv-kd18:0.4.eng: 1. Discussion of the proper conduct for newly-arrived monks

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āgantukā bhikkhū saupāhanāpi ārāmaṃ pavisanti, chattappaggahitāpi ārāmaṃ pavisanti, oguṇṭhitāpi ārāmaṃ pavisanti, sīsepi cīvaraṃ karitvā ārāmaṃ pavisanti, pānīyenapi pāde dhovanti, vuḍḍhatarepi āvāsike bhikkhū na abhivādenti, napi senāsanaṃ pucchanti.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.2.eng: At that time newly-arrived monks entered the monastery wearing sandals, holding sunshades, with their heads covered, with their robes on their heads; and they washed their feet with drinking water, did not bow down to the resident monks who were senior to them, and did not ask about dwellings.

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.3.pli: Aññataropi āgantuko bhikkhu anajjhāvuṭṭhaṃ vihāraṃ ghaṭikaṃ ugghāṭetvā kavāṭaṃ paṇāmetvā sahasā pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.3.eng: A certain newly-arrived monk lifted the latch of an unoccupied dwelling, opened the door, and entered hastily.

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.4.eng: A snake fell from above the door frame onto his shoulders.

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.7.eng: and asked him why he was screaming.

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.8.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.8.eng: And he told them what had happened.

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.9.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.9.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma āgantukā bhikkhū saupāhanāpi ārāmaṃ pavisissanti, chattappaggahitāpi ārāmaṃ pavisissanti, oguṇṭhitāpi ārāmaṃ pavisissanti, sīsepi cīvaraṃ karitvā ārāmaṃ pavisissanti, pānīyenapi pāde dhovissanti, vuḍḍhatarepi āvāsike bhikkhū na abhivādessanti, napi senāsanaṃ pucchissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.10.eng: “How can the newly-arrived monks enter the monastery wearing sandals, holding sunshades, with their heads covered, with their robe on their head; and wash their feet with drinking water, not bow down to the resident monks who are senior to them, and not ask about dwellings?”

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.11.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.11.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, āgantukā bhikkhū saupāhanāpi ārāmaṃ pavisanti, chattappaggahitāpi ārāmaṃ pavisanti, oguṇṭhitāpi ārāmaṃ pavisanti, sīsepi cīvaraṃ karitvā ārāmaṃ pavisanti, pānīyenapi pāde dhovanti, vuḍḍhatarepi āvāsike bhikkhū na abhivādenti, napi senāsanaṃ pucchantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.12.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the newly-arrived monks are acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma bhikkhave āgantukā bhikkhū saupāhanāpi ārāmaṃ pavisissanti, chattappaggahitāpi ārāmaṃ pavisissanti, oguṇṭhitāpi ārāmaṃ pavisissanti, sīsepi cīvaraṃ karitvā ārāmaṃ pavisissanti, pānīyenapi pāde dhovissanti, vuḍḍhatarepi āvāsike bhikkhū na abhivādessanti, napi senāsanaṃ pucchissanti, netaṃ bhikkhave appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.15.eng: “How can the newly-arrived monks act like this? This will affect people’s confidence …”

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.17.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:1.1.18.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā āgantukehi bhikkhūhi sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.18.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct for newly-arrived monks.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.1.pli: Āgantukena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā ‘idāni ārāmaṃ pavisissāmī’ti upāhanā omuñcitvā nīcaṃ katvā papphoṭetvā gahetvā chattaṃ apanāmetvā sīsaṃ vivaritvā sīse cīvaraṃ khandhe katvā sādhukaṃ ataramānena ārāmo pavisitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.1.eng: When a newly-arrived monk enters a monastery, he should remove his sandals, hold them low, knock them together, and carry them along; he should lower his sunshade, uncover his head, and put his robe over his shoulders; he should then enter the monastery carefully and without hurry.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.3.eng: he should look out for where the resident monks gather—
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.3.comm: Sp 4.357: Paṭikkamantīti sannipatanti, “Paṭikkamanti: (where) they gather.”

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.5.pli: upaṭṭhānasālāya vā maṇḍape vā rukkhamūle vā—
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.5.eng: whether in the assembly hall, under a roof cover, or at the foot of a tree—

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.7.eng: He should then put down his bowl and robe,

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.8.eng: find a suitable seat, and sit down.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.10.eng: which is the water for drinking and which the water for washing.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.11.pli: Sace pānīyena attho hoti, pānīyaṃ gahetvā pātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.11.eng: If he needs water to drink, he may take some and drink.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.12.pli: Sace paribhojanīyena attho hoti, paribhojanīyaṃ gahetvā pādā dhovitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.12.eng: If he needs water to wash, he may take some and wash his feet.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.13.pli: Pāde dhovantena ekena hatthena udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ, ekena hatthena pādā dhovitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.13.eng: When he washes his feet, he should pour the water with one hand and wash with the other.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.14.pli: Na teneva udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ na teneva hatthena pādā dhovitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.14.eng: He shouldn’t pour the water and wash his feet with the same hand.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.15.eng: He should ask for a sandal-wiping cloth, and then wipe them.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.16.pli: Upāhanā puñchantena paṭhamaṃ sukkhena coḷakena puñchitabbā, pacchā allena.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.16.eng: When he wipes his sandals, he should first wipe them with a dry cloth, then with a wet one.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.17.eng: He should wash the cloth and spread it out.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.17.comm: Sp 4.357: Vissajjetabbanti pattharitabbaṁ, “Vissajjetabba: to be spread out.”

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.18.pli: Sace āvāsiko bhikkhu vuḍḍho hoti, abhivādetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.18.eng: If a resident monk is senior to him, the newly-arrived monk should bow down to him.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.19.eng: If a resident monk is junior, he should bow down to the newly-arrived monk.

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.20.eng: The newly-arrived monk should ask which dwelling he may stay in

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.21.pli: Ajjhāvuṭṭhaṃ vā anajjhāvuṭṭhaṃ vā pucchitabbaṃ, gocaro pucchitabbo, agocaro pucchitabbo, sekkhasammatāni kulāni pucchitabbāni, vaccaṭṭhānaṃ pucchitabbaṃ, passāvaṭṭhānaṃ pucchitabbaṃ, pānīyaṃ pucchitabbaṃ, paribhojanīyaṃ pucchitabbaṃ, kattaradaṇḍo pucchitabbo, saṅghassa katikasaṇṭhānaṃ pucchitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.21.eng: and whether it’s occupied or not. He should ask about where to go for alms and where not to go, about any families designated as “in training”, about the place for defecating and the place for urinating, about the water for drinking and the water for washing, about walking sticks, and about the Sangha’s agreements

pli-tv-kd18:1.2.22.eng: concerning the right time to enter and the right time to leave.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.1.pli: Sace vihāro anajjhāvuttho hoti, kavāṭaṃ ākoṭetvā muhuttaṃ āgametvā ghaṭikaṃ ugghāṭetvā kavāṭaṃ paṇāmetvā bahi ṭhitena nilloketabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.1.eng: If the dwelling is unoccupied, he should knock on the door, wait for a moment, then lift the latch, open the door, and look inside while standing outside.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.2.pli: Sace vihāro uklāpo hoti, mañce vā mañco āropito hoti, pīṭhe vā pīṭhaṃ āropitaṃ hoti, senāsanaṃ upari puñjīkataṃ hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.2.eng: If the dwelling is dirty, and if the beds or benches are stacked on top of one another with furniture piled on top, he should clean it if he’s able.
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.2.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “furniture” for senāsana, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.3.pli: Vihāraṃ sodhentena paṭhamaṃ bhūmattharaṇaṃ nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.3.eng: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the floor cover and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.4.eng: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.5.eng: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.6.eng: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.6.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “sitting mat” for nisīdana, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.7.pli: mañco nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.7.eng: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.8.pli: pīṭhaṃ nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.8.eng: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.9.eng: He should take out the spittoon and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.10.eng: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.11.pli: Sace vihāre santānakaṃ hoti, ullokā paṭhamaṃ ohāretabbaṃ, ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.11.eng: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.12.pli: Sace gerukaparikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.12.eng: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.13.pli: Sace kāḷavaṇṇakatā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.13.eng: If the floor has been treated with a black finish and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.14.pli: Sace akatā hoti bhūmi, udakena paripphositvā sammajjitabbā—
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.14.eng: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.15.eng: trying to avoid stirring up dust.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.16.eng: He should look out for any trash and discard it.

pli-tv-kd18:1.4.1.pli: Bhūmattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.4.1.eng: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:1.4.2.pli: Mañcapaṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.4.2.eng: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and put them back where they were.

pli-tv-kd18:1.4.3.pli: Mañco otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāṭhāne paññapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:1.4.3.eng: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:1.4.4.pli: Pīṭhaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāṭhāne paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.4.4.eng: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:1.4.5.pli: Bhisibibbohanaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathābhāgaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.4.5.eng: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:1.4.6.pli: Nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathābhāgaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.4.6.eng: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:1.4.7.pli: Kheḷamallako otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathābhāgaṃ ṭhapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:1.4.7.eng: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd18:1.4.8.pli: Apassenaphalakaṃ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathābhāgaṃ ṭhapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.4.8.eng: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.1.eng: He should put away the bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.2.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.2.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.3.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.3.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.4.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.4.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.5.pli: Sace puratthimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, puratthimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.5.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.6.pli: Sace pacchimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, pacchimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.6.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.7.pli: Sace uttarā sarajā vātā vāyanti, uttarā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.7.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.8.pli: Sace dakkhiṇā sarajā vātā vāyanti, dakkhiṇā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.8.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.9.pli: Sace sītakālo hoti, divā vātapānā vivaritabbā, rattiṃ thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.9.eng: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.10.pli: Sace uṇhakālo hoti, divā vātapānā thaketabbā, rattiṃ vivaritabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.10.eng: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.11.pli: Sace pariveṇaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, pariveṇaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.11.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.11.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “yard” for pariveṇa, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.12.pli: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.12.eng: If the gatehouse is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.12.comm: For the rendering “gatehouse” for koṭṭhaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.13.pli: Sace upaṭṭhānasālā uklāpā hoti, upaṭṭhānasālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.13.eng: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.14.pli: Sace aggisālā uklāpā hoti, aggisālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.14.eng: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.14.comm: For aggisālā as “water-boiling shed”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.15.pli: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.15.eng: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.16.pli: Sace pānīyaṃ na hoti, pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.16.eng: If there’s no water for drinking, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.17.pli: Sace paribhojanīyaṃ na hoti, paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.17.eng: If there’s no water for washing, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.18.pli: Sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.18.eng: If there’s no water in the restroom ablutions pot, he should fill it.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.19.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ yathā āgantukehi bhikkhūhi sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:1.5.19.eng: This is the proper conduct for newly-arrived monks.”

pli-tv-kd18:2.1.0.eng: 2. Discussion of the proper conduct for resident monks

pli-tv-kd18:2.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āvāsikā bhikkhū āgantuke bhikkhū disvā neva āsanaṃ paññapenti, na pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipanti, na paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggaṇhanti, na pānīyena pucchanti, na vuḍḍhatarepi āgantuke bhikkhū abhivādenti, na senāsanaṃ paññapenti.
pli-tv-kd18:2.1.1.eng: At that time, when they saw newly-arrived monks, the resident monks did not prepare seats, or put out foot stools, foot scrapers, or water for washing the feet. They did not go out to meet them to receive their bowls and robes, or ask if they wanted water to drink. They did not bow down to newly-arrived monks who were senior to them or assign dwellings to them.

pli-tv-kd18:2.1.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:2.1.2.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:2.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma āvāsikā bhikkhū āgantuke bhikkhū disvā neva āsanaṃ paññapessanti, na pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipissanti, na paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahissanti, na pānīyena pucchissanti, vuḍḍhatarepi āgantuke bhikkhū na abhivādessanti, na senāsanaṃ paññapessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:2.1.3.eng: “How can the resident monks act like this?”

pli-tv-kd18:2.1.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:2.1.4.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:2.1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the resident monks are acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd18:2.1.8.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:2.1.9.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā āvāsikehi bhikkhūhi sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:2.1.9.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct for resident monks.

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.1.pli: Āvāsikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā āgantukaṃ bhikkhuṃ vuḍḍhataraṃ disvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, pānīyena pucchitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:2.2.1.eng: When a resident monk sees a newly-arrived monk who is senior to him, he should prepare a seat, and put out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet him to receive his bowl and robe, and ask if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.2.eng: If he’s able, he should wipe his sandals,

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.3.pli: Upāhanā puñchantena paṭhamaṃ sukkhena coḷakena puñchitabbā, pacchā allena.
pli-tv-kd18:2.2.3.eng: first with a dry cloth and then with a wet one.

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.4.eng: He should wash the cloth and spread it out.

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.5.eng: If the newly-arrived monk is senior to him, the resident monk should bow down to him.

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.6.eng: He should assign him a dwelling,

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.8.eng: and inform him whether it’s occupied or not.

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.9.eng: He should tell him where to go for alms

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.11.eng: and about any families designated as ‘in training’.

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.12.eng: He should point out the place for defecating

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.17.eng: He should tell him about the Sangha’s agreements

pli-tv-kd18:2.2.18.eng: concerning the right time to enter and the right time to leave.

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.1.eng: If the newly-arrived monk is junior to him, the resident monk should remain seated

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.2.pli: ‘atra pattaṃ nikkhipāhi, atra cīvaraṃ nikkhipāhi, idaṃ āsanaṃ nisīdāhī’ti.
pli-tv-kd18:2.3.2.eng: while telling him where to put his bowl and robe, and which seat to sit on.

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.3.eng: He should point out the water for drinking

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.5.eng: as well as a sandal-wiping cloth.

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.6.eng: If the newly-arrived monk is junior to the resident monk, he should bow down to him.

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.7.eng: The resident monk should tell him

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.8.eng: which dwelling he may stay in

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.9.eng: and whether it’s occupied or not.

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.10.eng: He should tell him where to go for alms

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.12.eng: and about any families designated as ‘in training’.

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.13.eng: He should point out the place for defecating

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.18.eng: He should tell him about the Sangha’s agreements

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.19.eng: concerning the right time to enter and the right time to leave.

pli-tv-kd18:2.3.20.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ yathā āvāsikehi bhikkhūhi sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:2.3.20.eng: This is the proper conduct for resident monks.”

pli-tv-kd18:3.1.0.eng: 3. Discussion of the proper conduct for departing monks

pli-tv-kd18:3.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena gamikā bhikkhū dārubhaṇḍaṃ mattikābhaṇḍaṃ appaṭisāmetvā dvāravātapānaṃ vivaritvā senāsanaṃ anāpucchā pakkamanti.
pli-tv-kd18:3.1.1.eng: At that time there were monks who departed without putting the wooden and ceramic goods in order, without closing the door and the windows, and without informing anyone.

pli-tv-kd18:3.1.2.eng: The wooden and ceramic goods were lost

pli-tv-kd18:3.1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:3.1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:3.1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma gamikā bhikkhū dārubhaṇḍaṃ mattikābhaṇḍaṃ appaṭisāmetvā dvāravātapānaṃ vivaritvā senāsanaṃ anāpucchā pakkamissanti.
pli-tv-kd18:3.1.5.eng: “How can the departing monks act like this?”

pli-tv-kd18:3.1.8.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:3.1.8.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:3.1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the departing monks are acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd18:3.1.12.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:3.1.13.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, gamikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā gamikehi bhikkhūhi sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:3.1.13.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct for departing monks.

pli-tv-kd18:3.2.1.pli: Gamikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā dārubhaṇḍaṃ mattikābhaṇḍaṃ paṭisāmetvā dvāravātapānaṃ thaketvā senāsanaṃ āpucchā pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:3.2.1.eng: Before a monk departs, he should put the wooden and ceramic goods in order, close the door and the windows, and inform someone.

pli-tv-kd18:3.2.2.pli: Sace bhikkhu na hoti, sāmaṇero āpucchitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:3.2.2.eng: If there are no monks, he should inform a novice monk;

pli-tv-kd18:3.2.3.pli: Sace sāmaṇero na hoti, ārāmiko āpucchitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:3.2.3.eng: if there are no novice monks, he should inform a monastery worker;

pli-tv-kd18:3.2.4.pli: Sace ārāmiko na hoti, upāsako āpucchitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:3.2.4.eng: if there are no monastery workers, he should inform a lay follower.

pli-tv-kd18:3.2.5.pli: Sace na hoti bhikkhu vā sāmaṇero vā ārāmiko vā upāsako vā, catūsu pāsāṇesu mañcaṃ paññapetvā mañce mañcaṃ āropetvā pīṭhe pīṭhaṃ āropetvā senāsanaṃ upari puñjaṃ karitvā dārubhaṇḍaṃ mattikābhaṇḍaṃ paṭisāmetvā dvāravātapānaṃ thaketvā pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:3.2.5.eng: If there are no monks, novice monks, monastery workers, or lay followers, he should place the bed on four rocks. He should then stack the beds and benches on top of one another, with the other furniture piled on top, and put away the wooden and ceramic goods. He should close the door and the windows, and then depart.

pli-tv-kd18:3.3.1.pli: Sace vihāro ovassati, sace ussahati, chādetabbo, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:3.3.1.eng: If rain enters the dwelling, he should cover it if he’s able, or he should make an effort

pli-tv-kd18:3.3.3.eng: If this works out, all is well.

pli-tv-kd18:3.3.4.pli: No ce labhetha, yo deso anovassako hoti, tattha catūsu pāsāṇesu mañcaṃ paññapetvā mañce mañcaṃ āropetvā pīṭhe pīṭhaṃ āropetvā senāsanaṃ upari puñjaṃ karitvā dārubhaṇḍaṃ mattikābhaṇḍaṃ paṭisāmetvā dvāravātapānaṃ thaketvā pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:3.3.4.eng: If not, he should place the bed on four rocks in a dry spot. He should then stack the beds and benches on top of one another, with the other furniture piled on top, and put away the wooden and ceramic goods. He should close the door and the windows, and then depart.

pli-tv-kd18:3.3.5.pli: Sace sabbo vihāro ovassati, sace ussahati, senāsanaṃ gāmaṃ atiharitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:3.3.5.eng: If the whole dwelling is getting wet, he should carry the furniture to the village if he’s able, or he should make an effort

pli-tv-kd18:3.3.6.eng: to have it carried to the village.

pli-tv-kd18:3.3.7.eng: If this works out, all is well.

pli-tv-kd18:3.3.8.pli: No ce labhetha, ajjhokāse catūsu pāsāṇesu mañcaṃ paññapetvā mañce mañcaṃ āropetvā pīṭhe pīṭhaṃ āropetvā senāsanaṃ upari puñjaṃ karitvā dārubhaṇḍaṃ mattikābhaṇḍaṃ paṭisāmetvā tiṇena vā paṇṇena vā paṭicchādetvā pakkamitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:3.3.8.eng: If not, he should place the bed on four rocks outside. He should then stack the beds and benches on top of one another, with the other furniture piled on top, and he should put away the wooden and ceramic goods. He should cover it all with grass and leaves and then depart,

pli-tv-kd18:3.3.9.eng: thinking, ‘Hopefully the requisites will be okay.’

pli-tv-kd18:3.3.10.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, gamikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ yathā gamikehi bhikkhūhi sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:3.3.10.eng: This is the proper conduct for departing monks.”

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.0.eng: 4. Discussion of the proper conduct in connection with the expression of appreciation

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bhattagge na anumodanti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.1.eng: At that time there were monks who did not express their appreciation in the dining hall.
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.1.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “dining hall” for bhattagga, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā bhattagge na anumodissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.3.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics not express their appreciation in the dining hall?”

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.4.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.4.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.6.eng: The Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.7.eng: “You should express your appreciation in the dining hall.”

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.9.eng: “Who should give the expression of appreciation?”

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.11.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.11.eng: He gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.12.eng: “The most senior monk should give the expression of appreciation in the dining hall.”

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.13.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa pūgassa saṅghabhattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.13.eng: Soon afterwards a certain association was offering a meal to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.14.eng: Venerable Sāriputta was the most senior monk.

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.16.eng: Because the Buddha had said the most senior monk should give the expression of appreciation,

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.17.eng: the other monks left, leaving Sāriputta behind by himself.

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.18.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto te manusse paṭisammoditvā pacchā ekako agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.18.eng: After giving the expression of appreciation, he left by himself.

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.19.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ dūratova ekakaṃ āgacchantaṃ.

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.23.pli: api ca maṃ bhikkhū ekakaṃ ohāya pakkantā”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.23.eng: but the monks all left, leaving me behind by myself.”

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.24.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.24.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.25.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhattagge catūhi pañcahi therānutherehi bhikkhūhi āgametun”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.25.eng: “The four or five most senior monks should wait in the dining hall.”

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.26.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro thero bhattagge vaccito āgamesi.
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.26.eng: On one occasion a senior monk who needed to defecate was waiting in the dining hall.

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.27.pli: So vaccaṃ sandhāretuṃ asakkonto mucchito papati.
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.27.eng: Being unable to hold out, he fainted and fell over.

pli-tv-kd18:4.1.29.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sati karaṇīye ānantarikaṃ bhikkhuṃ āpucchitvā gantun”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.1.29.eng: “When there’s something to be done, I allow you to go after informing the monk next to you.”

pli-tv-kd18:4.2.0.eng: 5. Discussion of the proper conduct in relation to dining halls

pli-tv-kd18:4.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā bhattaggaṃ gacchanti, vokkammapi therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ purato purato gacchanti, therepi bhikkhū anupakhajja nisīdanti, navepi bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhanti, saṅghāṭimpi ottharitvā antaraghare nisīdanti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.2.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six walked to the dining hall shabbily dressed and improper in appearance. Taking a short cut, they walked in front of the senior monks. They sat down encroaching on the senior monks and blocked the junior monks from getting a seat. And they spread out their upper robes and sat on them in inhabited areas.
pli-tv-kd18:4.2.1.comm: For a discussion of the bhattagga, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:4.2.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:4.2.2.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:4.2.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā bhattaggaṃ gacchissanti, vokkammapi therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ purato purato gacchissanti, therepi bhikkhū anupakhajja nisīdissanti, navepi bhikkhū āsanenapi paṭibāhissanti, saṅghāṭimpi ottharitvā antaraghare nisīdissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.2.3.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six act like this?”

pli-tv-kd18:4.2.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:4.2.4.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:4.2.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā bhattaggaṃ gacchanti, vokkammapi therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ purato purato gacchanti, therepi bhikkhū anupakhajja nisīdanti, navepi bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhanti, saṅghāṭimpi ottharitvā antaraghare nisīdantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd18:4.2.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six are acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd18:4.2.8.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:4.2.9.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ bhattaggavattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā bhikkhūhi bhattagge sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:4.2.9.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct in relation to dining halls.

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.1.pli: Sace ārāme kālo ārocito hoti, timaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentena parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsetvā kāyabandhanaṃ bandhitvā saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo pārupitvā gaṇṭhikaṃ paṭimuñcitvā dhovitvā pattaṃ gahetvā sādhukaṃ ataramānena gāmo pavisitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:4.3.1.eng: In a monastery where the time for departure gets announced, a monk should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees. He should put on a belt. Putting the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, he should put them on and fasten the toggle. He should rinse his bowl, bring it along, and enter the village carefully and without hurry.
pli-tv-kd18:4.3.1.comm: “Putting the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge” renders saguṇaṁ katvā saṅghāṭiyo. Sp 3.66: Saguṇaṁ katvāti dve cīvarāni ekato katvā, tā ekato katā dvepi saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā. Sabbañhi cīvaraṁ saṅghaṭitattā “saṅghāṭī”ti vuccati, “Saguṇaṁ katvā: having made two robes into one, even those two upper robes made into one are to be given. All robes are called saṅghāṭi because of being pieced together.” For a further discussion of the meaning of saṅghāṭi, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.2.pli: Na vokkamma therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ purato purato gantabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:4.3.2.eng: He shouldn’t take a short cut and walk in front of the senior monks.

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.3.eng: He should be well-covered while walking in inhabited areas;
pli-tv-kd18:4.3.3.comm: This rule of conduct is the same as Bu Sk 3:0.5.

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.4.eng: he should be well-restrained while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.5.eng: he should lower his eyes while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.6.eng: he shouldn’t lift his robe while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.7.eng: he shouldn’t laugh loudly while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.8.eng: he shouldn’t be noisy while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.9.eng: he shouldn’t sway his body while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.10.eng: he shouldn’t swing his arms while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.11.eng: he shouldn’t sway his head while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.12.eng: he shouldn’t have his hands on his hips while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.13.eng: he shouldn’t cover his head while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.14.eng: he shouldn’t move about while squatting on his heels in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.15.eng: He should be well-covered while sitting in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.16.eng: he should be well-restrained while sitting in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.17.eng: he should lower his eyes while sitting in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.18.eng: he shouldn’t lift his robe while sitting in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.19.eng: he shouldn’t laugh loudly while sitting in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.20.eng: he shouldn’t be noisy while sitting in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.21.eng: he shouldn’t sway his body while sitting in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.22.eng: he shouldn’t swing his arms while sitting in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.23.eng: he shouldn’t sway his head while sitting in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.24.eng: he shouldn’t have his hands on his hips while sitting in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.25.eng: he shouldn’t cover his head while sitting in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.26.eng: he shouldn’t clasp his knees while sitting in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.27.eng: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.28.eng: or block the junior monks from getting a seat.

pli-tv-kd18:4.3.29.eng: He shouldn’t spread out his upper robe and sit on it in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.1.pli: Udake diyyamāne ubhohi hatthehi pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā udakaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:4.4.1.eng: When given water, he should receive it while holding his bowl with both hands.

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.2.pli: Nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena patto dhovitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:4.4.2.eng: Holding the bowl low, he should rinse it carefully without scratching it.

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.3.pli: Sace udakappaṭiggāhako hoti, nīcaṃ katvā udakappaṭiggahe udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:4.4.3.eng: If there’s someone to receive the water, he should hold his bowl low and pour the water into the container,

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.4.pli: mā udakappaṭiggāhako udakena osiñci, mā sāmantā bhikkhū udakena osiñciṃsu, mā saṅghāṭi udakena osiñcīti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.4.4.eng: trying to avoid splashing the person receiving the water, the monks sitting nearby, and his upper robe.

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.5.pli: Sace udakappaṭiggāhako na hoti, nīcaṃ katvā chamāya udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:4.4.5.eng: If there’s no-one to receive the water, he should hold his bowl low and pour the water on the ground,

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.6.pli: mā sāmantā bhikkhū udakena osiñciṃsu, mā saṅghāṭi udakena osiñcīti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.4.6.eng: trying to avoid splashing the monks sitting nearby and his upper robe.

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.7.pli: Odane diyyamāne ubhohi hatthehi pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā odano paṭiggahetabbo, sūpassa okāso kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:4.4.7.eng: When given rice, he should receive it while holding his bowl with both hands, leaving room for the curry.

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.8.pli: Sace hoti sappi vā telaṃ vā uttaribhaṅgaṃ vā, therena vattabbo—
pli-tv-kd18:4.4.8.eng: If there’s ghee, oil, or special curry, the senior monk should say,

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.10.eng: He should receive the almsfood respectfully;
pli-tv-kd18:4.4.10.comm: This rule of conduct is the same as Bu Sk 27:0.5.

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.11.eng: he should receive the almsfood with attention on the bowl;

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.12.eng: he should receive the almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry;

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.13.eng: he should receive an even level of almsfood.

pli-tv-kd18:4.4.14.pli: Na tāva therena bhuñjitabbaṃ yāva na sabbesaṃ odano sampatto hoti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.4.14.eng: The senior monk shouldn’t start eating until everyone has received rice.

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.1.eng: A monk should eat almsfood respectfully;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.2.eng: he should eat almsfood with attention on the bowl;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.3.eng: he should eat almsfood in order;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.4.eng: he should eat almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.5.eng: he shouldn’t eat almsfood after making a heap;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.6.pli: Na sūpaṃ vā byañjanaṃ vā odanena paṭicchādetabbaṃ bhiyyokamyataṃ upādāya.
pli-tv-kd18:4.5.6.eng: he shouldn’t cover his curries with rice because he wants more;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.7.pli: Na sūpaṃ vā odanaṃ vā agilānena attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:4.5.7.eng: when not sick, he shouldn’t request bean curry and rice for himself and then eat it;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.8.eng: he shouldn’t look at another’s almsbowl finding fault;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.9.eng: he shouldn’t make mouthfuls that are too large;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.11.eng: he shouldn’t open his mouth without bringing a mouthful to it;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.12.pli: Na bhuñjamānena sabbo hattho mukhe pakkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:4.5.12.eng: he shouldn’t put his whole hand in his mouth while eating;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.13.eng: he shouldn’t speak with food in his mouth;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.14.eng: he shouldn’t eat from a lifted ball of food;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.15.eng: he shouldn’t eat breaking up mouthfuls;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.16.eng: he shouldn’t eat stuffing his cheeks;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.17.eng: he shouldn’t eat shaking his hand;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.19.eng: he shouldn’t eat sticking out his tongue;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.20.eng: he shouldn’t make a chomping sound while eating;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.22.eng: he shouldn’t lick his hands while eating;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.23.eng: he shouldn’t lick his almsbowl while eating;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.24.eng: he shouldn’t lick his lips while eating;

pli-tv-kd18:4.5.25.eng: he shouldn’t receive the drinking-water vessel with a hand soiled with food.

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.1.pli: Na tāva therena udakaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ yāva na sabbeva bhuttāvino honti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.6.1.eng: The senior monk shouldn’t receive water for washing until all the monks are finished eating.

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.2.pli: Udake diyyamāne ubhohi hatthehi pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā udakaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:4.6.2.eng: When given water, a monk should receive it while holding his bowl with both hands.

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.3.pli: Nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena patto dhovitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:4.6.3.eng: Holding the bowl low, he should rinse it carefully without scratching it.

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.4.pli: Sace udakappaṭiggāhako hoti, nīcaṃ katvā udakappaṭiggahe udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:4.6.4.eng: If there’s someone to receive the water, he should hold his bowl low and pour the water into the container,

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.5.pli: mā udakappaṭiggāhako udakena osiñci, mā sāmantā bhikkhū udakena osiñciṃsu, mā saṅghāṭi udakena osiñcīti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.6.5.eng: trying to avoid splashing the person receiving the water, the monks sitting nearby, and his upper robe.

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.6.pli: Sace udakappaṭiggāhako na hoti, nīcaṃ katvā chamāya udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:4.6.6.eng: If there’s no-one to receive the water, he should hold his bowl low and pour the water on the ground,

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.7.pli: mā sāmantā bhikkhū udakena osiñciṃsu, mā saṅghāṭi udakena osiñcīti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.6.7.eng: trying to avoid splashing the monks sitting nearby and his upper robe.

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.8.eng: He shouldn’t discard bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.9.pli: Nivattantena navakehi bhikkhūhi paṭhamataraṃ nivattitabbaṃ, pacchā therehi.
pli-tv-kd18:4.6.9.eng: When returning, the junior monks should go first and then the senior monks.

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.10.eng: A monk should be well-covered while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.11.eng: he should be well-restrained while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.12.eng: he should lower his eyes while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.13.eng: he shouldn’t lift his robe while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.14.eng: he shouldn’t laugh loudly while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.15.eng: he shouldn’t be noisy while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.16.eng: he shouldn’t sway his body while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.17.eng: he shouldn’t swing his arms while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.18.eng: he shouldn’t sway his head while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.19.eng: he shouldn’t have his hands on his hips while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.20.eng: he shouldn’t cover his head while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.21.eng: he shouldn’t move about while squatting on his heels in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.22.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ bhattaggavattaṃ yathā bhikkhūhi bhattagge sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:4.6.22.eng: This is the proper conduct in relation to dining halls.”

pli-tv-kd18:4.6.23.eng: The first section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.0.eng: 6. Discussion of the proper conduct for alms collectors

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena piṇḍacārikā bhikkhū dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā piṇḍāya caranti, asallakkhetvāpi nivesanaṃ pavisanti, asallakkhetvāpi nikkhamanti, atisahasāpi pavisanti, atisahasāpi nikkhamanti, atidūrepi tiṭṭhanti, accāsannepi tiṭṭhanti, aticirampi tiṭṭhanti, atilahumpi nivattanti.
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.1.eng: At that time there were alms-collecting monks who were shabbily dressed and improper in appearance. They entered and left houses without being attentive, entered and left too hastily, stood too far away or too close, and waited too long or left too soon.

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.2.pli: Aññataropi piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu asallakkhetvā nivesanaṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.2.eng: On one occasion a certain monk entered a house without being attentive.

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.3.pli: So ca dvāraṃ maññamāno aññataraṃ ovarakaṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.3.eng: Thinking it was the main door, he entered a room

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.4.pli: Tasmimpi ovarake itthī naggā uttānā nipannā hoti.
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.4.eng: where a woman was lying naked.

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.5.pli: Addasā kho so bhikkhu taṃ itthiṃ naggaṃ uttānaṃ nipannaṃ.

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.7.pli: “nayidaṃ dvāraṃ, ovarakaṃ idan”ti tamhā ovarakā nikkhami.

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.8.pli: Addasā kho tassā itthiyā sāmiko taṃ itthiṃ naggaṃ uttānaṃ nipannaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.8.eng: But when her husband saw her there,

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.10.pli: “iminā me bhikkhunā pajāpatī dūsitā”ti taṃ bhikkhuṃ gahetvā ākoṭesi.
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.10.eng: he thought, “My wife has been raped by this monk,” and he took hold of that monk and gave him a beating.

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.11.pli: Atha kho sā itthī tena saddena paṭibujjhitvā taṃ purisaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.11.eng: The woman woke up from the commotion and asked her husband,

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.15.pli: akārako so bhikkhū”ti taṃ bhikkhuṃ muñcāpesi.
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.15.eng: He’s innocent.” And she had him release that monk.

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.16.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.16.eng: The monk then returned to the monastery and told the monks what had happened.

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.17.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.17.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.18.pli: “kathañhi nāma piṇḍacārikā bhikkhū dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā piṇḍāya carissanti, asallakkhetvāpi nivesanaṃ pavisissanti, asallakkhetvāpi nikkhamissanti, atisahasāpi pavisissanti, atisahasāpi nikkhamissanti, atidūrepi tiṭṭhissanti, accāsannepi tiṭṭhissanti, aticirampi tiṭṭhissanti, atilahumpi nivattissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.18.eng: “How can the alms-collecting monks act like this?”

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.19.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.19.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.20.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the alms-collecting monks are acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.23.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:5.1.24.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, piṇḍacārikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā piṇḍacārikehi bhikkhūhi sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:5.1.24.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct for alms-collecting monks.

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.1.eng: When an alms-collecting monk is about to enter the village,

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.2.pli: ‘idāni gāmaṃ pavisissāmī’ti timaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentena parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsetvā kāyabandhanaṃ bandhitvā saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo pārupitvā gaṇṭhikaṃ paṭimuñcitvā dhovitvā pattaṃ gahetvā sādhukaṃ ataramānena gāmo pavisitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:5.2.2.eng: he should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees. He should put on a belt. Putting the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, he should put them on and fasten the toggle. He should rinse his bowl, bring it along, and enter the village carefully and without hurry.

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.3.eng: He should be well-covered while walking in an inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.4.eng: he should be well-restrained while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.5.eng: he should lower his eyes while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.6.eng: he shouldn’t lift his robe while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.7.eng: he shouldn’t laugh loudly while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.8.eng: he shouldn’t be noisy while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.9.eng: he shouldn’t sway his body while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.10.eng: he shouldn’t swing his arms while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.11.eng: he shouldn’t sway his head while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.12.eng: he shouldn’t have his hands on his hips while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.13.eng: he shouldn’t cover his head while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.14.eng: he shouldn’t move about while squatting on his heels in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.16.eng: he should be attentive to where to enter and where to leave.

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.24.eng: he should be attentive to whether they wish to give alms or not.

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.25.pli: Sace kammaṃ vā nikkhipati, āsanā vā vuṭṭhāti, kaṭacchuṃ vā parāmasati, bhājanaṃ vā parāmasati, ṭhapeti vā—dātukāmassāti ṭhātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:5.2.25.eng: If they put down their work, get up from their seat, take hold of a serving spoon or a vessel, or they tell him to wait, then he should assume they wish to give, and he should wait.
pli-tv-kd18:5.2.25.comm: “Tell him to wait” renders ṭhapeti. Sp-ṭ 4.366: Ṭhapeti vāti “tiṭṭhatha, bhante”ti vadantī ṭhapeti nāma, “Ṭhapeti vā: saying, ‘Wait, venerable sir’, is called ṭhapeti vā.”

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.26.pli: Bhikkhāya diyyamānāya vāmena hatthena saṅghāṭiṃ uccāretvā dakkhiṇena hatthena pattaṃ paṇāmetvā ubhohi hatthehi pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā bhikkhā paṭiggahetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:5.2.26.eng: When they give him almsfood, he should lift his upper robe with his left hand, stretch out his bowl with his right hand, and receive the alms while holding the bowl with both hands.

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.27.eng: He shouldn’t look the donor in the face.

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.29.eng: to whether they wish to give curry or not.

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.30.pli: Sace kaṭacchuṃ vā parāmasati, bhājanaṃ vā parāmasati, ṭhapeti vā—
pli-tv-kd18:5.2.30.eng: If they take hold of a serving spoon or a vessel, or they tell him to wait,

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.31.eng: then he should assume they wish to give, and he should wait.

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.32.pli: Bhikkhāya dinnāya saṅghāṭiyā pattaṃ paṭicchādetvā sādhukaṃ ataramānena nivattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:5.2.32.eng: When they have given alms, he should cover the bowl with his upper robe, and leave carefully and without hurry.

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.33.eng: He should be well-covered while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.34.eng: he should be well-restrained while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.35.eng: he should lower his eyes while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.36.eng: he shouldn’t lift his robe while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.37.eng: he shouldn’t laugh loudly while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.38.eng: he shouldn’t be noisy while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.39.eng: he shouldn’t sway his body while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.40.eng: he shouldn’t swing his arms while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.41.eng: he shouldn’t sway his head while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.42.eng: he shouldn’t have his hands on his hips while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.43.eng: he shouldn’t cover his head while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:5.2.44.eng: he shouldn’t move about while squatting on his heels in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd18:5.3.1.pli: Yo paṭhamaṃ gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati, tena āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, avakkārapāti dhovitvā upaṭṭhāpetabbā, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:5.3.1.eng: Whoever returns first from almsround in the village should prepare the seats and set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should wash the bowl for leftovers and put it back out, and set out water for drinking and water for washing.

pli-tv-kd18:5.3.2.pli: Yo pacchā gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati, sace hoti bhuttāvaseso, sace ākaṅkhati, bhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:5.3.2.eng: Whoever returns last from almsround may eat whatever is left over,

pli-tv-kd18:5.3.3.pli: No ce ākaṅkhati, appaharite vā chaḍḍetabbaṃ, appāṇake vā udake opilāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:5.3.3.eng: or he should discard it where there are no cultivated plants or in water without life.
pli-tv-kd18:5.3.3.comm: Harita could in principle refer to all plants, but it is elsewhere defined as what is cultivated, see Bu Pc 19:2.1.14 and Bi Pc 9:2.1.14.

pli-tv-kd18:5.3.4.pli: Tena āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmetabbaṃ, avakkārapāti dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbā, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ paṭisāmetabbaṃ, bhattaggaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:5.3.4.eng: He should put away the seats and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet. He should wash the bowl for leftovers and put it away, put away the water for drinking and the water for washing, and sweep the dining hall.

pli-tv-kd18:5.3.5.pli: Yo passati pānīyaghaṭaṃ vā paribhojanīyaghaṭaṃ vā vaccaghaṭaṃ vā rittaṃ tucchaṃ tena upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:5.3.5.eng: Whoever sees that the pot for drinking water, the pot for washing water, or the restroom pot is empty should fill it.

pli-tv-kd18:5.3.6.pli: Sacassa hoti avisayhaṃ, hatthavikārena dutiyaṃ āmantetvā hatthavilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ, na ca tappaccayā vācā bhinditabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:5.3.6.eng: If he can’t do it by himself, he should call someone over by hand signal and they should fill it together. He shouldn’t speak because of that.

pli-tv-kd18:5.3.7.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, piṇḍacārikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ yathā piṇḍacārikehi bhikkhūhi sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:5.3.7.eng: This is the proper conduct for alms collectors.”

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.0.eng: 7. Discussion of the proper conduct for those staying in the wilderness

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū araññe viharanti.
pli-tv-kd18:6.1.1.eng: At that time there was a number of monks staying in the wilderness.

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.2.pli: Te neva pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpenti, na paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpenti, na aggiṃ upaṭṭhāpenti, na araṇisahitaṃ upaṭṭhāpenti, na nakkhattapadāni jānanti, na disābhāgaṃ jānanti.
pli-tv-kd18:6.1.2.eng: They did not set out water for drinking or water for washing, did not light fires or provide fire-making implements, and did not know the constellations or the regions.
pli-tv-kd18:6.1.2.comm: Vin-ālaṅ-ṭ 27.190: Aggi upaṭṭhāpetabbotiādi vāḷamigasarīsapādibāhiraparissayakāle ca vātapittādiajjhattapaassayakāle ca icchitabbattā, “Aggi upaṭṭhāpetabbo, etc., means what is required at a time of danger outside from wild animals, snakes, and centipedes, and at a time of refuge indoors due to wind, bile, and other illnesses.” The point seems to be that they should have access to fire. “Constellation” here refers to the constellation the moon is “stationed in” at any particular time, sometimes known as a “lunar mansion”, a “lunar house”, or a “lunar station.” As the earth orbits the sun, the moon appears to be moving from one constellation to the next. By observing the movement of the moon, one can determine what is the current month or fortnight. Regarding the translation “region” for disā, see below.

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.3.pli: Corā tattha gantvā te bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:6.1.3.eng: Criminals went to that place and asked the monks,

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.4.eng: “Sir, is there any water for drinking?” —

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.12.eng: “Which constellation is the moon in today?” —
pli-tv-kd18:6.1.12.comm: Sp 4.367: Kenajja, bhante, yuttanti kena nakkhattena ajja cando yuttoti, “Kenajja, bhante, yutta: With which constellation is the moon connected today?”

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.14.comm: Here the common rendering of “cardinal direction” for disā does not work. Consequently, I render disā as “region” throughout this section.

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.17.pli: “nevimesaṃ pānīyaṃ atthi, na paribhojanīyaṃ atthi, na aggi atthi, na araṇisahitaṃ atthi, na nakkhattapadāni jānanti, na disābhāgaṃ jānanti;

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.19.eng: they beat them up and left.

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.20.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:6.1.20.eng: The monks told other monks what had happened

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.21.eng: and they in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.22.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd18:6.1.22.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.23.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, āraññikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā āraññikehi bhikkhūhi sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:6.1.23.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct for monks staying in the wilderness.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.1.pli: Āraññikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā kālasseva uṭṭhāya pattaṃ thavikāya pakkhipitvā aṃse ālaggetvā cīvaraṃ khandhe karitvā upāhanā ārohitvā dārubhaṇḍaṃ mattikābhaṇḍaṃ paṭisāmetvā dvāravātapānaṃ thaketvā senāsanā otaritabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.1.eng: After getting up early in the morning, a monk who is staying in the wilderness should put his bowl in its bag, hang it from his shoulder, put his robe over his shoulders, put on his sandals, put the wooden and ceramic goods in order, close the door and windows, and come down from his dwelling.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.2.eng: When he’s about to enter the village,

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.3.pli: Upāhanā omuñcitvā nīcaṃ katvā papphoṭetvā thavikāya pakkhipitvā aṃse ālaggetvā timaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentena parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsetvā kāyabandhanaṃ bandhitvā saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo pārupitvā gaṇṭhikaṃ paṭimuñcitvā dhovitvā pattaṃ gahetvā sādhukaṃ ataramānena gāmo pavisitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.3.eng: he should remove his sandals, hold them low and knock them together. He should put them in a bag, which he should hang from his shoulder. He should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees, and he should put on a belt. Putting the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, he should put them on and fasten the toggle. He should rinse his bowl, bring it along, and enter the village carefully and without hurry.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.4.eng: He should be well-covered while walking in inhabited areas; he should be well-restrained while walking in inhabited areas; he should lower his eyes while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t lift his robe while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t laugh loudly while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t be noisy while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t sway his body while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t swing his arms while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t sway his head while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.5.eng: he shouldn’t have his hands on his hips while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.6.eng: he shouldn’t cover his head while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.7.eng: he shouldn’t move about while squatting on his heels in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.9.eng: he should be attentive to where to enter and where to leave.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.17.eng: he should be attentive to whether they wish to give alms or not.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.18.pli: Sace kammaṃ vā nikkhipati, āsanā vā vuṭṭhāti, kaṭacchuṃ vā parāmasati, bhājanaṃ vā parāmasati, ṭhapeti vā—
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.18.eng: If they put down their work, get up from their seat, take hold of a serving spoon or a vessel, or they tell him to wait,

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.19.eng: then he should assume they wish to give, and he should wait.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.20.pli: Bhikkhāya diyyamānāya vāmena hatthena saṅghāṭiṃ uccāretvā dakkhiṇena hatthena pattaṃ paṇāmetvā ubhohi hatthehi pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā bhikkhā paṭiggahetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.20.eng: When they give him almsfood, he should lift his upper robe with his left hand, stretch out his bowl with his right hand, and receive the alms while holding the bowl with both hands.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.21.eng: He shouldn’t look the donor in the face.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.23.eng: to whether they wish to give curry or not.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.24.pli: Sace kaṭacchuṃ vā parāmasati, bhājanaṃ vā parāmasati, ṭhapeti vā—
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.24.eng: If they take hold of a serving spoon or a vessel, or they tell him to wait,

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.25.eng: then he should assume they wish to give, and he should wait.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.26.pli: Bhikkhāya dinnāya saṅghāṭiyā pattaṃ paṭicchādetvā sādhukaṃ ataramānena nivattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.26.eng: When they have given alms, he should cover the bowl with his upper robe, and return carefully and without hurry.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.27.eng: He should be well-covered while walking in inhabited areas; he should be well-restrained while walking in inhabited areas; he should lower his eyes while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t lift his robe while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t laugh loudly while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t be noisy while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t sway his body while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t swing his arms while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t sway his head while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t have his hands on his hips while walking in inhabited areas; he shouldn’t cover his head while walking in inhabited areas;

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.28.eng: he shouldn’t move about while squatting on his heels in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd18:6.3.1.pli: Gāmato nikkhamitvā pattaṃ thavikāya pakkhipitvā aṃse ālaggetvā cīvaraṃ saṅgharitvā sīse karitvā upāhanā ārohitvā gantabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:6.3.1.eng: When he has left the village, he should put his bowl in its bag and hang it from his shoulder, fold up his robe and put it on his head, and put on his sandals and go.

pli-tv-kd18:6.3.2.pli: Āraññikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ, paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ, aggi upaṭṭhāpetabbo, araṇisahitaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ, kattaradaṇḍo upaṭṭhāpetabbo, nakkhattapadāni uggahetabbāni—
pli-tv-kd18:6.3.2.eng: A monk who is staying in the wilderness should set out water for drinking and water for washing, should light a fire and provide fire-making implements, should provide a walking stick, and should learn the constellations—

pli-tv-kd18:6.3.3.pli: sakalāni vā ekadesāni vā, disākusalena bhavitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:6.3.3.eng: either all of them or a portion—and become skilled in the regions.

pli-tv-kd18:6.3.4.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, āraññikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ yathā āraññikehi bhikkhūhi sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:6.3.4.eng: This is the proper conduct for those staying in the wilderness.”

pli-tv-kd18:7.1.0.eng: 8. Discussion of the proper conduct in regard to dwellings

pli-tv-kd18:7.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū ajjhokāse cīvarakammaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.1.eng: On one occasion when a number of monks were making robes outside,

pli-tv-kd18:7.1.2.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū paṭivāte aṅgaṇe senāsanaṃ papphoṭesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were beating furniture in an open space upwind from them.

pli-tv-kd18:7.1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:7.1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū paṭivāte aṅgaṇe senāsanaṃ papphoṭessanti.
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.5.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?”

pli-tv-kd18:7.1.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.7.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:7.1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū paṭivāte aṅgaṇe senāsanaṃ papphoṭenti, bhikkhū rajena okiriṃsū”ti?
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six did this?”

pli-tv-kd18:7.1.11.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:7.1.12.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ senāsanavattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā bhikkhūhi senāsane sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.12.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct in regard to dwellings.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.1.pli: Yasmiṃ vihāre viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.1.eng: If the dwelling he’s staying in is dirty, a monk should clean it if he’s able.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.2.pli: Vihāraṃ sodhentena paṭhamaṃ pattacīvaraṃ nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.2.eng: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.3.eng: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.4.eng: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.5.pli: mañco nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.5.eng: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.6.pli: pīṭhaṃ nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.6.eng: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.7.eng: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.8.eng: He should take out the spittoon and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.9.eng: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.10.pli: bhummattharaṇaṃ yathāpaññattaṃ sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.10.eng: After taking note of its position, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.11.pli: Sace vihāre santānakaṃ hoti, ullokā paṭhamaṃ ohāretabbaṃ, ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.11.eng: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.12.pli: Sace gerukaparikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.12.eng: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.13.pli: Sace kāḷavaṇṇakatā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.13.eng: If the floor has been treated with a black finish and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.14.pli: Sace akatā hoti bhūmi, udakena paripphositvā paripphositvā sammajjitabbā—
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.14.eng: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.15.eng: trying to avoid stirring up dust.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.16.eng: He should look out for any trash and discard it.

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.17.eng: He shouldn’t beat the furniture near other monks,

pli-tv-kd18:7.2.21.eng: He shouldn’t beat the furniture in an open area upwind from these things,

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.1.pli: Bhummattharaṇaṃ ekamantaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.1.eng: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.2.pli: Mañcapaṭipādakā ekamantaṃ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.2.eng: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and put them back where they were.

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.3.pli: Mañco ekamantaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.3.eng: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.4.pli: Pīṭhaṃ ekamantaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.4.eng: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.5.pli: Bhisibibbohanaṃ ekamantaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.5.eng: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.6.pli: Nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṃ ekamantaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.6.eng: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.7.pli: Kheḷamallako ekamantaṃ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.7.eng: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.8.pli: Apassenaphalakaṃ ekamantaṃ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.8.eng: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.9.eng: He should put away the bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.10.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.10.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.11.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.11.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd18:7.3.12.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.12.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.1.pli: Sace puratthimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, puratthimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.1.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.2.pli: Sace pacchimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, pacchimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.2.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.3.pli: Sace uttarā sarajā vātā vāyanti uttarā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.3.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.4.pli: Sace dakkhiṇā sarajā vātā vāyanti, dakkhiṇā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.4.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.5.pli: Sace sītakālo hoti, divā vātapānā vivaritabbā, rattiṃ thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.5.eng: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.6.pli: Sace uṇhakālo hoti, divā vātapānā thaketabbā, rattiṃ vivaritabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.6.eng: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.7.pli: Sace pariveṇaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, pariveṇaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.7.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.8.pli: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.8.eng: If the gatehouse is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.9.pli: Sace upaṭṭhānasālā uklāpā hoti, upaṭṭhānasālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.9.eng: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.10.pli: Sace aggisālā uklāpā hoti, aggisālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.10.eng: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.11.pli: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.11.eng: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.12.pli: Sace pānīyaṃ na hoti, pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.12.eng: If there’s no water for drinking, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.13.pli: Sace paribhojanīyaṃ na hoti, paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.13.eng: If there’s no water for washing, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.14.pli: Sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.14.eng: If there’s no water in the restroom ablutions pot, he should fill it.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.15.pli: Sace vuḍḍhena saddhiṃ ekavihāre viharati, na vuḍḍhaṃ anāpucchā uddeso dātabbo, na paripucchā dātabbā, na sajjhāyo kātabbo, na dhammo bhāsitabbo, na padīpo kātabbo, na padīpo vijjhāpetabbo, na vātapānā vivaritabbā, na vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.15.eng: If he’s staying in the same dwelling as a more senior monk, he shouldn’t do any of the following without asking him for permission: recite, question, rehearse, teach, turn a lamp on or off, or open or close a window.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.16.pli: Sace vuḍḍhena saddhiṃ ekacaṅkame caṅkamati, yena vuḍḍho tena parivattitabbaṃ, na ca vuḍḍho saṅghāṭikaṇṇena ghaṭṭetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.16.eng: If he’s doing walking meditation on the same walking path as a more senior monk, they should turn around according to seniority, but he shouldn’t touch the senior monk with the corner of his robe.

pli-tv-kd18:7.4.17.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ senāsanavattaṃ yathā bhikkhūhi senāsane sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.17.eng: This is the proper conduct in regard to dwellings.”

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.0.eng: 9. Discussion of the proper conduct in regard to saunas

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jantāghare therehi bhikkhūhi nivāriyamānā anādariyaṃ paṭicca pahūtaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ āropetvā aggiṃ datvā dvāraṃ thaketvā dvāre nisīdanti.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six were kept out of the sauna by the senior monks. Then, out of disrespect, they stacked up much firewood, lit it, closed the door, and sat down against it.

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.2.pli: Bhikkhū uṇhābhitattā dvāraṃ alabhamānā mucchitā papatanti.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.2.eng: The monks overheated, but being unable to open the door, they fainted and collapsed.

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jantāghare therehi bhikkhūhi nivāriyamānā anādariyaṃ paṭicca pahūtaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ āropetvā aggiṃ datvā dvāraṃ thaketvā dvāre nisīdissanti.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.4.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?”

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.5.pli: Bhikkhū uṇhābhitattā dvāraṃ alabhamānā mucchitā papatantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.6.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jantāghare therehi bhikkhūhi nivāriyamānā anādariyaṃ paṭicca pahūtaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ āropetvā aggiṃ datvā dvāraṃ thaketvā dvāre nisīdanti;
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six did this?”

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.8.pli: bhikkhū uṇhābhitattā dvāraṃ alabhamānā mucchitā papatantī”ti?

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.11.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.12.pli: “na, bhikkhave, jantāghare therena bhikkhunā nivāriyamānena anādariyaṃ paṭicca pahūtaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ āropetvā aggi dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.12.eng: “If you’re kept out of the sauna by senior monks, you shouldn’t, out of disrespect, stack up much firewood and light it.

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.13.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.14.pli: Na, bhikkhave, dvāraṃ thaketvā dvāre nisīditabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.14.eng: And you shouldn’t close the door and sit down against it.

pli-tv-kd18:8.1.15.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.1.pli: Tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ jantāgharavattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā bhikkhūhi jantāghare sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.1.eng: Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct in regard to saunas.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.1.comm: See discussion on the jantāghara in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.2.pli: Yo paṭhamaṃ jantāgharaṃ gacchati, sace chārikā ussannā hoti, chārikā chaḍḍetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.2.eng: The monk who goes first to the sauna should discard any ashes that are building up.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.3.pli: Sace jantāgharaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, jantāgharaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.3.eng: If the sauna is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.4.pli: Sace paribhaṇḍaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, paribhaṇḍaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.4.eng: If the area surrounding the sauna is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.4.comm: Sp 4.371: Paribhaṇḍanti bahijagati, “Paribhaṇḍa: the floor outside.”

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.5.pli: Sace pariveṇaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, pariveṇaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.5.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.6.pli: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.6.eng: If the gatehouse is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.7.pli: Sace jantāgharasālā uklāpā hoti, jantāgharasālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.7.eng: If the sauna shed is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.8.pli: Cuṇṇaṃ sannetabbaṃ, mattikā temetabbā, udakadoṇikāya udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.8.eng: He should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, and fill the water trough with water.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.9.pli: Jantāgharaṃ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṃ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṃ pavisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.9.eng: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.10.eng: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.11.eng: or block the junior monks from getting a seat.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.12.pli: Sace ussahati, jantāghare therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ parikammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.12.eng: If he’s able, he should provide assistance to the senior monks in the sauna.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.13.pli: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.13.eng: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench, cover himself front and back, and then leave.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.14.pli: Sace ussahati, udakepi therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ parikammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.14.eng: If he’s able, he should also provide assistance to the senior monks in the water.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.15.pli: Na therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ puratopi nahāyitabbaṃ, na uparitopi nahāyitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.15.eng: He shouldn’t bathe in front of the senior monks or upstream from them.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.16.eng: When he’s coming out of the water after bathing, he should give way to those who are entering the water.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.17.pli: Yo pacchā jantāgharā nikkhamati, sace jantāgharaṃ cikkhallaṃ hoti, dhovitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.17.eng: If the sauna is muddy, the last monk to leave it should clean it.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.18.pli: Mattikādoṇikaṃ dhovitvā jantāgharapīṭhaṃ paṭisāmetvā aggiṃ vijjhāpetvā dvāraṃ thaketvā pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.18.eng: He should wash the clay trough, put away the sauna bench, extinguish the fire, close the door, and then leave.

pli-tv-kd18:8.2.19.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ jantāgharavattaṃ yathā bhikkhūhi jantāghare sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.19.eng: This is the proper conduct in regard to saunas.”

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.0.eng: 10. Discussion of the proper conduct in regard to restrooms

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu brāhmaṇajātiko vaccaṃ katvā na icchati ācametuṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.1.eng: At that time a monk who had been born as a brahmin did not want to wash after defecating, thinking,

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.2.eng: “Who would touch this foul, stinking stuff?”

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.3.eng: As a result, a worm settled in his rectum.

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.4.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.4.eng: He told the monks, who said,

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.5.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, āvuso, vaccaṃ katvā na ācamesī”ti?
