pli-tv-kd18:9.1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu vaccaṃ katvā na ācamessatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.8.eng: “How can a monk not wash after defecating?”

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.9.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, vaccaṃ katvā na ācamesī”ti?
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.10.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you don’t wash after defecating?”

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.13.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.14.pli: “na, bhikkhave, vaccaṃ katvā sati udake nācametabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.14.eng: “When there’s water available, you should wash after defecating.

pli-tv-kd18:9.1.15.eng: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd18:10.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū vaccakuṭiyā yathāvuḍḍhaṃ vaccaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.1.eng: At that time the monks used the restrooms according to seniority.

pli-tv-kd18:10.1.2.pli: Navakā bhikkhū paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā vaccitā āgamenti.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.2.eng: Junior monks who had arrived first had to wait to defecate.

pli-tv-kd18:10.1.3.eng: Unable to hold out, they fainted and collapsed.

pli-tv-kd18:10.1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that this is happening?”

pli-tv-kd18:10.1.7.eng: “The restrooms shouldn’t be used according to seniority.

pli-tv-kd18:10.1.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd18:10.1.9.eng: You should use the restroom according to the order of arrival.”

pli-tv-kd18:10.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū atisahasāpi vaccakuṭiṃ pavisanti, ubbhajitvāpi pavisanti, nitthunantāpi vaccaṃ karonti, dantakaṭṭhaṃ khādantāpi vaccaṃ karonti, bahiddhāpi vaccadoṇikāya vaccaṃ karonti, bahiddhāpi passāvadoṇikāya passāvaṃ karonti, passāvadoṇikāyapi kheḷaṃ karonti, pharusenapi kaṭṭhena avalekhanti, avalekhanakaṭṭhampi vaccakūpamhi pātenti, atisahasāpi nikkhamanti, ubbhajitvāpi nikkhamanti, capucapukārakampi ācamenti, ācamanasarāvakepi udakaṃ sesenti.
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six entered the restrooms too hastily, pulled up their robes before entering, groaned while defecating, cleaned their teeth while defecating, defecated outside the toilet, urinated outside the urinal, spat in the urinal, used coarse wiping sticks, threw the wiping sticks in the cesspit, left the restroom too hastily, came out with their robes still pulled up, made a chomping sound while washing, and they left water in the ablutions scoop.

pli-tv-kd18:10.2.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.2.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:10.2.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū atisahasāpi vaccakuṭiṃ pavisissanti, ubbhajitvāpi pavisissanti, nitthunantāpi vaccaṃ karissanti, dantakaṭṭhaṃ khādantāpi vaccaṃ karissanti, bahiddhāpi vaccadoṇikāya vaccaṃ karissanti, bahiddhāpi passāvadoṇikāya passāvaṃ karissanti, passāvadoṇikāyapi kheḷaṃ karissanti, pharusenapi kaṭṭhena avalekhissanti, avalekhanakaṭṭhampi vaccakūpamhi pātessanti, atisahasāpi nikkhamissanti, ubbhajitvāpi nikkhamissanti, capucapukārakampi ācamessanti, ācamanasarāvakepi udakaṃ sesessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.3.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six act like this?”

pli-tv-kd18:10.2.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd18:10.2.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six are acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd18:10.2.8.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:10.2.9.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ vaccakuṭivattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā bhikkhūhi vaccakuṭiyā sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.9.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct in regard to restrooms.

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.1.pli: Yo vaccakuṭiṃ gacchati tena bahi ṭhitena ukkāsitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.1.eng: When a monk goes to the restroom, he should stand outside and clear his throat.

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.2.eng: Anyone sitting inside should also clear his throat.

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.3.pli: Cīvaravaṃse vā cīvararajjuyā vā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā sādhukaṃ ataramānena vaccakuṭi pavisitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.3.eng: After hanging his robe on a bamboo robe rack or a clothesline, he should enter the restroom carefully and without hurry.

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.4.eng: He shouldn’t enter the restroom too hastily;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.5.eng: he shouldn’t pull up his robe before he has entered;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.6.eng: he should pull up his robe when he’s standing on the foot stands for defecating;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.8.eng: he shouldn’t clean his teeth while defecating;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.9.eng: he shouldn’t defecate outside the toilet;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.10.eng: he shouldn’t urinate outside the urinal;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.11.eng: he shouldn’t spit in the urinal;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.12.eng: he shouldn’t use coarse wiping sticks;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.13.eng: he shouldn’t throw the wiping sticks in the cesspit;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.14.eng: he should cover himself while still standing on the foot stands for defecating;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.15.eng: he shouldn’t leave the restroom too hastily;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.16.eng: he shouldn’t come out with his robe still pulled up;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.17.eng: he should pull up his robe when standing on the ablutions foot stands;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.18.eng: he shouldn’t make a chomping sound while washing;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.19.eng: he shouldn’t leave water in the ablutions scoop;

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.20.eng: he should cover himself while still standing on the ablutions foot stands.

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.21.eng: If the restroom is dirty, he should clean it.

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.22.pli: Sace avalekhanapidharo pūro hoti, avalekhanakaṭṭhaṃ chaḍḍetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.22.eng: If the wiping-stick container is full, he should discard the wiping sticks.

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.23.pli: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.23.eng: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.24.pli: Sace paribhaṇḍaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, paribhaṇḍaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.24.eng: If the area surrounding the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.24.comm: “Area surrounding” renders paribhaṇḍa. Sp 4.371: Paribhaṇḍanti bahijagati, “Paribhaṇḍa: the floor outside.”

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.25.pli: Sace pariveṇaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, pariveṇaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.25.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.26.pli: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.26.eng: If the gatehouse is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.27.pli: Sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.27.eng: If there’s no water in the restroom ablutions pot, he should fill it.

pli-tv-kd18:10.3.28.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ vaccakuṭivattaṃ yathā bhikkhūhi vaccakuṭiyā sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.28.eng: This is the proper conduct in regard to restrooms.”

pli-tv-kd18:11.1.0.eng: 11. Discussion of the proper conduct toward a preceptor

pli-tv-kd18:11.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saddhivihārikā upajjhāyesu na sammā vattanti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.1.eng: At that time the students were not conducting themselves properly toward their preceptors.

pli-tv-kd18:11.1.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.2.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:11.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma saddhivihārikā upajjhāyesu na sammā vattissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.3.eng: “How can the students not conduct themselves properly toward their preceptors?”

pli-tv-kd18:11.1.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.4.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:11.1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, saddhivihārikā upajjhāyesu na sammā vattantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the students are not conducting themselves properly toward their preceptors?”

pli-tv-kd18:11.1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, saddhivihārikā upajjhāyesu na sammā vattissanti.

pli-tv-kd18:11.1.11.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:11.1.12.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saddhivihārikānaṃ upajjhāyesu vattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā saddhivihārikehi upajjhāyesu sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.12.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct for a student toward his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd18:11.2.1.eng: A student should conduct himself properly toward his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd18:11.2.3.1.pli: Kālasseva uṭṭhāya upāhanā omuñcitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukhodakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.2.3.1.eng: Having gotten up at the appropriate time, the student should remove his sandals and arrange his upper robe over one shoulder. He should then give his preceptor a tooth cleaner and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.

pli-tv-kd18:11.2.4.pli: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.2.4.eng: If there’s congee, he should rinse a vessel and bring the congee to his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd18:11.2.5.pli: Yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.2.5.eng: When he has drunk the congee, the student should give him water and receive the vessel. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd18:11.2.6.eng: When the preceptor has gotten up, the student should put away the seat.

pli-tv-kd18:11.2.7.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.2.7.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:11.3.1.pli: Sace upajjhāyo gāmaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, kāyabandhanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.3.1.eng: If the preceptor wants to enter the village, the student should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should rinse his preceptor’s bowl and give it to him while wet.

pli-tv-kd18:11.3.2.pli: Sace upajjhāyo pacchāsamaṇaṃ ākaṅkhati, timaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentena parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsetvā kāyabandhanaṃ bandhitvā saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo pārupitvā gaṇṭhikaṃ paṭimuñcitvā dhovitvā pattaṃ gahetvā upajjhāyassa pacchāsamaṇena hotabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.3.2.eng: If the preceptor wants an attendant, the student should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees. He should put on a belt. Putting the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, he should put them on and fasten the toggle. He should rinse his bowl, bring it along, and be his preceptor’s attendant.

pli-tv-kd18:11.3.3.pli: Nātidūre gantabbaṃ, nāccāsanne gantabbaṃ, pattapariyāpannaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.3.3.eng: He shouldn’t walk too far behind his preceptor or too close to him. He should receive the contents of his bowl.

pli-tv-kd18:11.4.1.pli: Na upajjhāyassa bhaṇamānassa antarantarā kathā opātetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.1.eng: He shouldn’t interrupt his preceptor when he’s speaking.

pli-tv-kd18:11.4.2.eng: But if the preceptor’s speech is bordering on an offense, he should stop him.

pli-tv-kd18:11.4.3.pli: Nivattantena paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.3.eng: When returning, the student should go first to prepare a seat and to set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the preceptor and receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.

pli-tv-kd18:11.4.4.pli: Sace cīvaraṃ sinnaṃ hoti, muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbaṃ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṃ nidahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.4.eng: If the robe is damp, he should sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd18:11.4.6.pli: Cīvaraṃ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṃ kaṇṇaṃ ussāretvā cīvaraṃ saṅgharitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.6.eng: offsetting the edges by seven centimeters,
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.6.comm: That is, four aṅgula. See discussion under sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:11.4.7.eng: so that the fold doesn’t become worn.

pli-tv-kd18:11.4.8.eng: He should place the belt in the fold.

pli-tv-kd18:11.4.9.pli: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, upajjhāyo ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṃ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.9.eng: If there’s almsfood and his preceptor wants to eat, the student should give him water and then the almsfood.

pli-tv-kd18:11.5.1.eng: He should ask his preceptor if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd18:11.5.2.pli: Bhuttāvissa udakaṃ datvā pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā vodakaṃ katvā muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.2.eng: When the preceptor has eaten, the student should give him water and receive his bowl. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while,

pli-tv-kd18:11.5.3.eng: but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd18:11.5.4.eng: The student should put away the robe and bowl.

pli-tv-kd18:11.5.5.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.5.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd18:11.5.6.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.6.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd18:11.5.7.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.7.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd18:11.5.8.pli: Upajjhāyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.8.eng: When the preceptor has gotten up, the student should put away the seat and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd18:11.5.9.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.9.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.”

pli-tv-kd18:11.6.1.pli: Sace upajjhāyo nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.6.1.eng: “If the preceptor wants to bathe, the student should prepare a bath.

pli-tv-kd18:11.6.2.pli: Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.6.2.eng: If he wants a cold bath, he should prepare that;

pli-tv-kd18:11.6.3.pli: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.6.3.eng: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.

pli-tv-kd18:11.6.4.pli: Sace upajjhāyo jantāgharaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṃ sannetabbaṃ, mattikā temetabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya upajjhāyassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṃ datvā cīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ, cuṇṇaṃ dātabbaṃ, mattikā dātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.6.4.eng: If the preceptor wants to take a sauna, the student should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take a sauna bench, and follow behind his preceptor. After giving his preceptor the sauna bench, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.

pli-tv-kd18:11.6.5.eng: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.

pli-tv-kd18:11.6.6.pli: Jantāgharaṃ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṃ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṃ pavisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.6.6.eng: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter.

pli-tv-kd18:11.7.1.eng: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,

pli-tv-kd18:11.7.2.eng: or block the junior monks from getting a seat.

pli-tv-kd18:11.7.3.eng: While in the sauna, he should provide assistance to his preceptor.

pli-tv-kd18:11.7.4.pli: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.7.4.eng: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench, cover himself front and back, and then leave.

pli-tv-kd18:11.7.5.eng: He should also provide assistance to his preceptor in the water.

pli-tv-kd18:11.7.6.pli: Nahātena paṭhamataraṃ uttaritvā attano gattaṃ vodakaṃ katvā nivāsetvā upajjhāyassa gattato udakaṃ pamajjitabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.7.6.eng: When he has bathed, he should be the first to come out. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his preceptor’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna bench, he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, and also set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd18:11.7.7.eng: He should ask his preceptor if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd18:11.8.1.eng: If the preceptor wants him to recite, he should do so.

pli-tv-kd18:11.8.2.eng: If the preceptor wants to question him, he should be questioned.”

pli-tv-kd18:11.8.3.1.pli: Yasmiṃ vihāre upajjhāyo viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.8.3.1.eng: “If the dwelling where the preceptor is staying is dirty, the student should clean it if he’s able.

pli-tv-kd18:11.8.4.pli: Vihāraṃ sodhentena paṭhamaṃ pattacīvaraṃ nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:11.8.4.eng: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:11.8.5.eng: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:11.8.6.eng: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.1.pli: mañco nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.1.eng: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.2.pli: pīṭhaṃ nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.2.eng: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.3.eng: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.4.eng: He should take out the spittoon and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.5.eng: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.6.pli: bhūmattharaṇaṃ yathāpaññattaṃ sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.6.eng: After taking note of its position, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.7.pli: Sace vihāre santānakaṃ hoti, ullokā paṭhamaṃ ohāretabbaṃ, ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.7.eng: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.8.pli: Sace gerukaparikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.8.eng: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.9.pli: Sace kāḷavaṇṇakatā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.9.eng: If the floor has been treated with a black finish and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.10.pli: Sace akatā hoti bhūmi, udakena paripphositvā paripphositvā sammajjitabbā—
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.10.eng: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.11.eng: trying to avoid stirring up dust.

pli-tv-kd18:11.9.12.eng: He should look out for any trash and discard it.

pli-tv-kd18:11.10.1.pli: Bhūmattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.1.eng: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:11.10.2.pli: Mañcapaṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.2.eng: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and put them back where they were.

pli-tv-kd18:11.10.3.pli: Mañco otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.3.eng: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:11.10.4.pli: Pīṭhaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.4.eng: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:11.10.5.pli: Bhisibibbohanaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.5.eng: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:11.10.6.pli: Nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.6.eng: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:11.10.7.pli: Kheḷamallako otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.7.eng: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd18:11.10.8.pli: Apassenaphalakaṃ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.8.eng: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd18:11.11.1.eng: He should put away the bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd18:11.11.2.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.11.2.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd18:11.11.3.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.11.3.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd18:11.11.4.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.11.4.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd18:11.12.1.pli: Sace puratthimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, puratthimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.1.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.

pli-tv-kd18:11.12.2.pli: Sace pacchimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, pacchimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.2.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side.

pli-tv-kd18:11.12.3.pli: Sace uttarā sarajā vātā vāyanti, uttarā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.3.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.

pli-tv-kd18:11.12.4.pli: Sace dakkhiṇā sarajā vātā vāyanti, dakkhiṇā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.4.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.

pli-tv-kd18:11.12.5.pli: Sace sītakālo hoti, divā vātapānā vivaritabbā, rattiṃ thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.5.eng: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.

pli-tv-kd18:11.12.6.pli: Sace uṇhakālo hoti, divā vātapānā thaketabbā, rattiṃ vivaritabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.6.eng: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.

pli-tv-kd18:11.13.1.pli: Sace pariveṇaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, pariveṇaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.1.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:11.13.2.pli: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.2.eng: If the gatehouse is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:11.13.3.pli: Sace upaṭṭhānasālā uklāpā hoti, upaṭṭhānasālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.3.eng: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:11.13.4.pli: Sace aggisālā uklāpā hoti, aggisālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.4.eng: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:11.13.5.pli: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.5.eng: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:11.13.6.pli: Sace pānīyaṃ na hoti, pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.6.eng: If there’s no water for drinking, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd18:11.13.7.pli: Sace paribhojanīyaṃ na hoti, paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.7.eng: If there’s no water for washing, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd18:11.13.8.pli: Sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.8.eng: If there’s no water in the restroom ablutions pot, he should fill it.”

pli-tv-kd18:11.14.1.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, saddhivihārikena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.14.1.eng: “If the preceptor becomes discontent with the spiritual life, the student should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:11.14.2.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa kukkuccaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, saddhivihārikena vinodetabbaṃ, vinodāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.14.2.eng: If the preceptor becomes anxious, the student should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:11.14.3.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti, saddhivihārikena vivecetabbaṃ, vivecāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:11.14.3.eng: If the preceptor has wrong view, the student should make him give it up or have someone else do it, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:11.15.1.pli: Sace upajjhāyo garudhammaṃ ajjhāpanno hoti parivāsāraho, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.1.eng: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,

pli-tv-kd18:11.15.2.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho upajjhāyassa parivāsaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.2.eng: the student should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:11.15.3.pli: Sace upajjhāyo mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.3.eng: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,

pli-tv-kd18:11.15.4.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho upajjhāyaṃ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.4.eng: the student should try to get the Sangha to do it.

pli-tv-kd18:11.15.5.pli: Sace upajjhāyo mānattāraho hoti, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.5.eng: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves the trial period,

pli-tv-kd18:11.15.6.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho upajjhāyassa mānattaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.6.eng: the student should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:11.15.7.pli: Sace upajjhāyo abbhānāraho hoti, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.7.eng: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,

pli-tv-kd18:11.15.8.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho upajjhāyaṃ abbheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.8.eng: the student should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:11.16.1.pli: Sace saṅgho upajjhāyassa kammaṃ kattukāmo hoti, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:11.16.1.eng: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his preceptor—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—
pli-tv-kd18:11.16.1.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “demotion” for niyassa, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:11.16.2.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho upajjhāyassa kammaṃ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.16.2.eng: the student should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.

pli-tv-kd18:11.16.3.pli: Kataṃ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṃ, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, saddhivihārikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:11.16.3.eng: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his preceptor—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd18:11.16.4.pli: kinti nu kho upajjhāyo sammā vatteyya, lomaṃ pāteyya, netthāraṃ vatteyya, saṅgho taṃ kammaṃ paṭippassambheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.16.4.eng: the student should help the preceptor conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try to get the Sangha to lift that procedure.
pli-tv-kd18:11.16.4.comm: The meaning of the first of these phrases, sammā vattati, is straightforward, but the last two, lomaṁ pāteti and netthāraṁ vattati, are more difficult. Commenting on Bu Ss 13, Sp 1.435 explains: Na lomaṁ pātentīti anulomapaṭipadaṁ appaṭipajjanatāya na pannalomā honti. Na netthāraṁ vattantīti attano nittharaṇamaggaṁ na paṭipajjanti, “Na lomaṁ pātenti: because of their non-practicing in conformity with the path, their bodily hairs are not flat. Na netthāraṁ vattanti: they are not practicing the path for their own getting out (of the offense).” My rendering attempts to capture the meaning in a non-literal way.

pli-tv-kd18:11.17.1.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ dhovitabbaṃ hoti, saddhivihārikena dhovitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.1.eng: If the preceptor’s robe needs washing, the student should do it himself,

pli-tv-kd18:11.17.2.pli: kinti nu kho upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ dhoviyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.2.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd18:11.17.3.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ kātabbaṃ hoti, saddhivihārikena kātabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.3.eng: If the preceptor needs a robe, the student should make one himself,

pli-tv-kd18:11.17.4.pli: kinti nu kho upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ kariyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.4.eng: or he should make an effort to get one made.

pli-tv-kd18:11.17.5.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa rajanā pacitabbā hoti, saddhivihārikena pacitabbā, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.5.eng: If the preceptor needs dye, the student should make it himself,

pli-tv-kd18:11.17.6.pli: kinti nu kho upajjhāyassa rajanaṃ paciyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.6.eng: or he should make an effort to get it made.

pli-tv-kd18:11.17.7.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ rajitabbaṃ hoti, saddhivihārikena rajitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.7.eng: If the preceptor’s robe needs dyeing, the student should do it himself,

pli-tv-kd18:11.17.8.pli: kinti nu kho upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ rajiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.8.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd18:11.17.9.pli: Cīvaraṃ rajantena sādhukaṃ samparivattakaṃ samparivattakaṃ rajitabbaṃ, na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.9.eng: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over, and shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.

pli-tv-kd18:11.18.1.pli: Na upajjhāyaṃ anāpucchā ekaccassa patto dātabbo, na ekaccassa patto paṭiggahetabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.1.eng: Without asking his preceptor for permission, he shouldn’t do any of the following: give away or receive a bowl;

pli-tv-kd18:11.18.2.pli: na ekaccassa cīvaraṃ dātabbaṃ, na ekaccassa cīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.2.eng: give away or receive a robe;

pli-tv-kd18:11.18.3.pli: na ekaccassa parikkhāro dātabbo, na ekaccassa parikkhāro paṭiggahetabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.3.eng: give away or receive a requisite;

pli-tv-kd18:11.18.4.pli: na ekaccassa kesā chedetabbā, na ekaccena kesā chedāpetabbā;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.4.eng: cut anyone’s hair or get it cut;

pli-tv-kd18:11.18.5.pli: na ekaccassa parikammaṃ kātabbaṃ, na ekaccena parikammaṃ kārāpetabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.5.eng: provide assistance to anyone or have assistance provided by anyone;

pli-tv-kd18:11.18.6.pli: na ekaccassa veyyāvacco kātabbo, na ekaccena veyyāvacco kārāpetabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.6.eng: do a service for anyone or get a service done by anyone;

pli-tv-kd18:11.18.7.pli: na ekaccassa pacchāsamaṇena hotabbaṃ, na ekacco pacchāsamaṇo ādātabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.7.eng: be the attendant monk for anyone or take anyone as his attendant monk;

pli-tv-kd18:11.18.8.pli: na ekaccassa piṇḍapāto nīharitabbo, na ekaccena piṇḍapāto nīharāpetabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.8.eng: bring back almsfood for anyone or get almsfood brought back by anyone;

pli-tv-kd18:11.18.12.pli: Sace upajjhāyo gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.12.eng: If his preceptor is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives or wait until he has recovered.

pli-tv-kd18:11.18.13.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, saddhivihārikānaṃ upajjhāyesu vattaṃ yathā saddhivihārikehi upajjhāyesu sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.13.eng: This is the proper conduct of a student toward his preceptor.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.1.0.eng: 12. Discussion of the proper conduct toward a student

pli-tv-kd18:12.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena upajjhāyā saddhivihārikesu na sammā vattanti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.1.1.eng: At that time the preceptors were not conducting themselves properly toward their students.

pli-tv-kd18:12.1.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:12.1.2.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:12.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma upajjhāyā saddhivihārikesu na sammā vattissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.1.3.eng: “How can the preceptors not conduct themselves properly toward their students?”

pli-tv-kd18:12.1.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:12.1.4.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:12.1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, upajjhāyā saddhivihārikesu na sammā vattantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd18:12.1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the preceptors are not conducting themselves properly toward their students?”

pli-tv-kd18:12.1.8.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:12.1.9.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, upajjhāyānaṃ saddhivihārikesu vattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā upajjhāyehi saddhivihārikesu sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.1.9.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct for preceptors toward their students.

pli-tv-kd18:12.2.1.eng: A preceptor should conduct himself properly toward his student.

pli-tv-kd18:12.2.3.pli: Upajjhāyena, bhikkhave, saddhivihāriko saṅgahetabbo anuggahetabbo uddesena paripucchāya ovādena anusāsaniyā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.3.eng: A preceptor should help and take care of his student through recitation, questioning, and instruction.

pli-tv-kd18:12.2.4.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa patto hoti, saddhivihārikassa patto na hoti, upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa patto dātabbo, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.4.eng: If the preceptor has a bowl, but not the student, the preceptor should give it to him,
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.4.comm: Sp 3.67: Sace upajjhāyassa patto hotīti sace atirekapatto hoti. Esa nayo sabbattha, “‘If the preceptor has a bowl’ means if the preceptor has an extra bowl. This method applies to everything (below).”

pli-tv-kd18:12.2.5.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa patto uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.5.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.

pli-tv-kd18:12.2.6.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa cīvaraṃ hoti, saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ na hoti, upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ dātabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.6.eng: If the preceptor has a robe, but not the student, the preceptor should give it to him,

pli-tv-kd18:12.2.7.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.7.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.

pli-tv-kd18:12.2.8.pli: Sace upajjhāyassa parikkhāro hoti, saddhivihārikassa parikkhāro na hoti, upajjhāyena saddhivihārikassa parikkhāro dātabbo, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.8.eng: If the preceptor has a requisite, but not the student, the preceptor should give it to him,

pli-tv-kd18:12.2.9.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa parikkhāro uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.9.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.3.1.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko gilāno hoti, kālasseva uṭṭhāya dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukhodakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.3.1.eng: “If the student is sick, the preceptor should get up at the appropriate time and give his student a tooth cleaner and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.3.2.pli: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.3.2.eng: If there’s congee, he should rinse a vessel and bring the congee to his student.

pli-tv-kd18:12.3.3.pli: Yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.3.3.eng: When he has drunk the congee, the preceptor should give him water and receive the vessel. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd18:12.3.4.eng: When the student has gotten up, the preceptor should put away the seat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.3.5.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.3.5.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.4.1.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko gāmaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, kāyabandhanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.4.1.eng: If the student wants to enter the village, the preceptor should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should rinse his student’s bowl and give it to him while wet.

pli-tv-kd18:12.4.2.pli: Ettāvatā nivattissatīti āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.4.2.eng: Before he’s due back, the preceptor should prepare a seat and set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the student and receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.

pli-tv-kd18:12.4.3.pli: Sace cīvaraṃ sinnaṃ hoti, muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbaṃ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṃ nidahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.4.3.eng: If the robe is damp, he should sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.4.5.pli: Cīvaraṃ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṃ kaṇṇaṃ ussāretvā cīvaraṃ saṅgharitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.4.5.eng: offsetting the edges by seven centimeters,
pli-tv-kd18:12.4.5.comm: That is, four aṅgula. See discussion under sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:12.4.6.eng: so that the fold doesn’t become worn.

pli-tv-kd18:12.4.7.eng: He should place the belt in the fold.

pli-tv-kd18:12.4.8.pli: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, saddhivihāriko ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṃ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.4.8.eng: If there’s almsfood and his student wants to eat, the preceptor should give him water and then the almsfood.

pli-tv-kd18:12.5.1.eng: He should ask his student if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd18:12.5.2.pli: Bhuttāvissa udakaṃ datvā pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā vodakaṃ katvā muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbo, na ca uṇhe patto nidahitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.5.2.eng: When the student has eaten, the preceptor should give him water and receive his bowl. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.5.3.eng: The preceptor should put away the robe and bowl.

pli-tv-kd18:12.5.4.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.5.4.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd18:12.5.5.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.5.5.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd18:12.5.6.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.5.6.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd18:12.5.7.pli: Saddhivihārikamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.5.7.eng: When the student has gotten up, the preceptor should put away the seat and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd18:12.5.8.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.5.8.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.6.1.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.6.1.eng: “If the student wants to bathe, the preceptor should prepare a bath.

pli-tv-kd18:12.6.2.pli: Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.6.2.eng: If he wants a cold bath, he should prepare that;

pli-tv-kd18:12.6.3.pli: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.6.3.eng: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.

pli-tv-kd18:12.6.4.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko jantāgharaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṃ sannetabbaṃ, mattikā temetabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṃ datvā cīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ, cuṇṇaṃ dātabbaṃ, mattikā dātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.6.4.eng: If the student wants to take a sauna, the preceptor should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take a sauna bench, and go to the sauna. After giving his student the sauna bench, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.

pli-tv-kd18:12.6.5.eng: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.

pli-tv-kd18:12.6.6.pli: Jantāgharaṃ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṃ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṃ pavisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.6.6.eng: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter.

pli-tv-kd18:12.7.1.pli: Na there bhikkhū anupakhajja nisīditabbaṃ, na navā bhikkhū āsanena paṭibāhitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.7.1.eng: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks, or block the junior monks from getting a seat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.7.2.eng: While in the sauna, he should provide assistance to his student.

pli-tv-kd18:12.7.3.pli: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.7.3.eng: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench, cover himself front and back, and then leave.

pli-tv-kd18:12.7.4.eng: The preceptor should also provide assistance to his student in the water.

pli-tv-kd18:12.7.5.pli: Nahātena paṭhamataraṃ uttaritvā attano gattaṃ vodakaṃ katvā nivāsetvā saddhivihārikassa gattato udakaṃ pamajjitabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.7.5.eng: When the preceptor has bathed, he should be the first to come out. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his student’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna bench, he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, and also set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd18:12.7.6.eng: He should ask his student if he wants water to drink.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.8.1.pli: Yasmiṃ vihāre saddhivihāriko viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.8.1.eng: “If the dwelling where the student is staying is dirty, the preceptor should clean it if he’s able.

pli-tv-kd18:12.8.2.1.pli: Vihāraṃ sodhentena paṭhamaṃ pattacīvaraṃ nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd18:12.8.2.1.eng: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside. He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside. He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside. Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside. Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside. He should take out the bed supports and put them aside. He should take out the spittoon and put it aside. He should take out the leaning board and put it aside. After taking note of its position, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside. If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room. If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls. If the floor has been treated with a black finish and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor. If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it, trying to avoid stirring up dust. He should look out for any trash and discard it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.8.2.2.eng: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back as before. He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and put them back where they were. He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before. He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before. He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were. He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were. He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was. He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was. He should put away the bowl and robe. When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away. He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor. When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd18:12.8.2.3.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side. If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side. If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side. If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side. If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night. If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.

pli-tv-kd18:12.8.2.4.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it. If the gatehouse is dirty, he should sweep it. If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it. If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it. If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it. If there’s no water for drinking, he should get some. If there’s no water for washing, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd18:12.8.3.pli: sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.8.3.eng: If there’s no water in the restroom ablutions pot, he should fill it.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.8.4.1.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, upajjhāyena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.8.4.1.eng: “If the student becomes discontent with the spiritual life, the preceptor should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:12.8.5.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa kukkuccaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena vinodetabbaṃ, vinodāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.8.5.eng: If the student becomes anxious, the preceptor should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:12.8.6.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena vivecetabbaṃ, vivecāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.8.6.eng: If the student has wrong view, the preceptor should make him give it up or have someone else do it, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:12.9.1.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko garudhammaṃ ajjhāpanno hoti parivāsāraho, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.9.1.eng: If the student has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,

pli-tv-kd18:12.9.2.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikassa parivāsaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.9.2.eng: the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.9.3.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.9.3.eng: If the student has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,

pli-tv-kd18:12.9.4.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikaṃ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.9.4.eng: the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to do it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.9.5.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko mānattāraho hoti, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.9.5.eng: If the student has committed a heavy offense and deserves the trial period,

pli-tv-kd18:12.9.6.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikassa mānattaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.9.6.eng: the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.9.7.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko abbhānāraho hoti, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.9.7.eng: If the student has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,

pli-tv-kd18:12.9.8.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikaṃ abbheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.9.8.eng: the preceptor should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.10.1.pli: Sace saṅgho saddhivihārikassa kammaṃ kattukāmo hoti, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.10.1.eng: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his student—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd18:12.10.2.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho saddhivihārikassa kammaṃ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.10.2.eng: the preceptor should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.

pli-tv-kd18:12.10.3.pli: Kataṃ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṃ, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā, ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, upajjhāyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.10.3.eng: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his student—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd18:12.10.4.pli: kinti nu kho saddhivihāriko sammā vatteyya lomaṃ pāteyya, netthāraṃ vatteyya, saṅgho taṃ kammaṃ paṭippassambheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.10.4.eng: the preceptor should help the student conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try to get the Sangha to lift that procedure.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.1.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ dhovitabbaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—evaṃ dhoveyyāsīti,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.1.eng: If the student’s robe needs washing, the preceptor should show him how to do it,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.2.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ dhoviyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.2.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.3.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ kātabbaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—evaṃ kareyyāsīti,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.3.eng: If the student needs a robe, the preceptor should show him how to make one,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.4.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ kariyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.4.eng: or he should make an effort to get one made.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.5.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa rajanaṃ pacitabbaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—evaṃ paceyyāsīti,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.5.eng: If the student needs dye, the preceptor should show him how to make it,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.6.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa rajanaṃ paciyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.6.eng: or he should make an effort to get it made.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.7.pli: Sace saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ rajitabbaṃ hoti, upajjhāyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—evaṃ rajeyyāsīti,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.7.eng: If the student’s robe needs dyeing, the preceptor should show him how to do it,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.8.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa cīvaraṃ rajiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.8.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.9.pli: Cīvaraṃ rajantena sādhukaṃ samparivattakaṃ samparivattakaṃ rajitabbaṃ, na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.9.eng: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over, and shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.10.pli: Sace saddhivihāriko gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.10.eng: If his student is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives or wait until he has recovered.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.11.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, upajjhāyānaṃ saddhivihārikesu vattaṃ yathā upajjhāyehi saddhivihārikesu sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.11.eng: This is the proper conduct of a preceptor toward his student.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.12.eng: The second section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.13.0.eng: 13. Discussion of the proper conduct toward a teacher

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.13.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena antevāsikā ācariyesu na sammā vattanti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.13.1.eng: At that time the pupils were not conducting themselves properly toward their teachers.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.14.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.14.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.15.pli: “kathañhi nāma antevāsikā ācariyesu na sammā vattissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.15.eng: “How can the pupils not conduct themselves properly toward their teachers?”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.16.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.17.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, antevāsikā ācariyesu na sammā vattantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.17.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the pupils are not conducting themselves properly toward their teachers?”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.20.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.21.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, antevāsikānaṃ ācariyesu vattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā antevāsikehi ācariyesu sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.21.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct for a pupil toward his teacher.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.22.eng: A pupil should conduct himself properly toward his teacher.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.24.1.pli: Kālasseva uṭṭhāya upāhanā omuñcitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukhodakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.24.1.eng: Having gotten up at the appropriate time, the pupil should remove his sandals, and arrange his upper robe over one shoulder. He should then give his teacher a tooth cleaner and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.25.pli: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.25.eng: If there’s congee, he should rinse a vessel and bring the congee to his teacher.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.26.pli: Yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.26.eng: When he has drunk the congee, the pupil should give him water and receive the vessel. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.27.eng: When the teacher has gotten up, the pupil should put away the seat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.28.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.28.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.29.pli: Sace ācariyo gāmaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, kāyabandhanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.29.eng: If the teacher wants to enter the village, the pupil should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should rinse his teacher’s bowl and give it to him while wet.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.30.pli: Sace ācariyo pacchāsamaṇaṃ ākaṅkhati, timaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentena parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsetvā kāyabandhanaṃ bandhitvā saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo pārupitvā gaṇṭhikaṃ paṭimuñcitvā dhovitvā pattaṃ gahetvā ācariyassa pacchāsamaṇena hotabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.30.eng: If the teacher wants an attendant, the pupil should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees. He should put on a belt. Putting the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, he should put them on and fasten the toggle. He should rinse his bowl, bring it along, and be his teacher’s attendant.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.31.pli: Nātidūre gantabbaṃ, nāccāsanne gantabbaṃ, pattapariyāpannaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.31.eng: He shouldn’t walk too far behind his teacher or too close to him. He should receive the contents of his bowl.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.32.pli: Na ācariyassa bhaṇamānassa antarantarā kathā opātetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.32.eng: He shouldn’t interrupt his teacher when he’s speaking.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.33.eng: But if the teacher’s speech is bordering on an offense, he should stop him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.34.pli: Nivattantena paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.34.eng: When returning, the pupil should go first to prepare a seat and to set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the teacher and receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.35.pli: Sace cīvaraṃ sinnaṃ hoti, muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbaṃ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṃ nidahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.35.eng: If the robe is damp, he should sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.37.pli: Cīvaraṃ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṃ kaṇṇaṃ ussāretvā cīvaraṃ saṅgharitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.37.eng: offsetting the edges by seven centimeters,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.37.comm: That is, four aṅgula. See discussion under sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.38.eng: so that the fold doesn’t become worn.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.39.eng: He should place the belt in the fold.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.40.pli: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, ācariyo ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṃ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.40.eng: If there’s almsfood and his teacher wants to eat, the pupil should give him water and then the almsfood.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.41.eng: He should ask his teacher if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.42.pli: Bhuttāvissa udakaṃ datvā pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā vodakaṃ katvā muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbo, na ca uṇhe patto nidahitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.42.eng: When the teacher has eaten, the pupil should give him water and receive his bowl. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.43.eng: The pupil should put away the robe and bowl.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.44.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.44.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.45.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.45.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.46.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.46.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.47.pli: Ācariyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.47.eng: When the teacher has gotten up, the pupil should put away the seat and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.48.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.48.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.49.1.pli: Sace ācariyo nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.49.1.eng: “If the teacher wants to bathe, the pupil should prepare a bath.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.50.pli: Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.50.eng: If he wants a cold bath, he should prepare that;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.51.pli: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.51.eng: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.52.pli: Sace ācariyo jantāgharaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṃ sannetabbaṃ, mattikā temetabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya ācariyassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṃ datvā cīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ, cuṇṇaṃ dātabbaṃ, mattikā dātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.52.eng: If the teacher wants to take a sauna, the pupil should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take a sauna bench, and follow behind his teacher. After giving his teacher the sauna bench, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.53.eng: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.54.pli: Jantāgharaṃ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṃ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṃ pavisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.54.eng: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.55.eng: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.56.eng: or block the junior monks from getting a seat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.57.eng: While in the sauna, he should provide assistance to his teacher.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.58.pli: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.58.eng: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench, cover himself front and back, and then leave.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.59.eng: He should also provide assistance to his teacher in the water.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.60.pli: Nahātena paṭhamataraṃ uttaritvā attano gattaṃ vodakaṃ katvā nivāsetvā ācariyassa gattato udakaṃ pamajjitabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.60.eng: When he has bathed, he should be the first to come out. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his teacher’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna bench, he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, and also set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.61.eng: He should ask his teacher if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.62.eng: If the teacher wants him to recite, he should do so.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.63.eng: If the teacher wants to question him, he should be questioned.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.64.1.pli: Yasmiṃ vihāre ācariyo viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.64.1.eng: “If the dwelling where the teacher is staying is dirty, the pupil should clean it if he’s able.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.65.pli: Vihāraṃ sodhentena paṭhamaṃ pattacīvaraṃ nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.65.eng: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.66.eng: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.67.eng: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.68.pli: mañco nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.68.eng: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.69.pli: pīṭhaṃ nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.69.eng: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.70.eng: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.71.eng: He should take out the spittoon and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.72.eng: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.73.pli: bhūmattharaṇaṃ yathāpaññattaṃ sallakkhetvā nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.73.eng: After taking note of its position, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.74.pli: Sace vihāre santānakaṃ hoti, ullokā paṭhamaṃ ohāretabbaṃ, ālokasandhikaṇṇabhāgā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.74.eng: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.75.pli: Sace gerukaparikammakatā bhitti kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.75.eng: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.76.pli: Sace kāḷavaṇṇakatā bhūmi kaṇṇakitā hoti, coḷakaṃ temetvā pīḷetvā pamajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.76.eng: If the floor has been treated with a black finish and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.77.pli: Sace akatā hoti bhūmi, udakena paripphositvā paripphositvā sammajjitabbā—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.77.eng: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.78.eng: trying to avoid stirring up dust.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.79.eng: He should look out for any trash and discard it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.80.pli: Bhūmattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.80.eng: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.81.pli: Mañcapaṭipādakā otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.81.eng: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and put them back where they were.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.82.pli: Mañco otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.82.eng: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.83.pli: Pīṭhaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena, asaṅghaṭṭentena kavāṭapiṭṭhaṃ, atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.83.eng: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.84.pli: Bhisibibbohanaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.84.eng: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.85.pli: Nisīdanapaccattharaṇaṃ otāpetvā sodhetvā papphoṭetvā atiharitvā yathāpaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.85.eng: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.86.pli: Kheḷamallako otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.86.eng: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.87.pli: Apassenaphalakaṃ otāpetvā pamajjitvā atiharitvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.87.eng: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.88.eng: He should put away the bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.89.pli: Pattaṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena pattaṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena heṭṭhāmañcaṃ vā heṭṭhāpīṭhaṃ vā parāmasitvā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.89.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.90.pli: Na ca anantarahitāya bhūmiyā patto nikkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.90.eng: He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.91.pli: Cīvaraṃ nikkhipantena ekena hatthena cīvaraṃ gahetvā ekena hatthena cīvaravaṃsaṃ vā cīvararajjuṃ vā pamajjitvā pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.91.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.92.pli: Sace puratthimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, puratthimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.92.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.93.pli: Sace pacchimā sarajā vātā vāyanti, pacchimā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.93.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.94.pli: Sace uttarā sarajā vātā vāyanti, uttarā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.94.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.95.pli: Sace dakkhiṇā sarajā vātā vāyanti, dakkhiṇā vātapānā thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.95.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.96.pli: Sace sītakālo hoti, divā vātapānā vivaritabbā, rattiṃ thaketabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.96.eng: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.97.pli: Sace uṇhakālo hoti, divā vātapānā thaketabbā, rattiṃ vivaritabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.97.eng: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.98.pli: Sace pariveṇaṃ uklāpaṃ hoti, pariveṇaṃ sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.98.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.99.pli: Sace koṭṭhako uklāpo hoti, koṭṭhako sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.99.eng: If the gatehouse is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.100.pli: Sace upaṭṭhānasālā uklāpā hoti, upaṭṭhānasālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.100.eng: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.101.pli: Sace aggisālā uklāpā hoti, aggisālā sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.101.eng: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.102.pli: Sace vaccakuṭi uklāpā hoti, vaccakuṭi sammajjitabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.102.eng: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.103.pli: Sace pānīyaṃ na hoti, pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.103.eng: If there’s no water for drinking, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.104.pli: Sace paribhojanīyaṃ na hoti, paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.104.eng: If there’s no water for washing, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.105.pli: Sace ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.105.eng: If there’s no water in the restroom ablutions pot, he should fill it.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.106.1.pli: Sace ācariyassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, antevāsikena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.106.1.eng: “If the teacher becomes discontent with the spiritual life, the pupil should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.107.pli: Sace ācariyassa kukkuccaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, antevāsikena vinodetabbaṃ, vinodāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.107.eng: If the teacher becomes anxious, the pupil should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.108.pli: Sace ācariyassa diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti, antevāsikena vivecetabbaṃ, vivecāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.108.eng: If the teacher has wrong view, the pupil should make him give it up or have someone else do it, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.109.pli: Sace ācariyo garudhammaṃ ajjhāpanno hoti, parivāsāraho, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.109.eng: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.110.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa parivāsaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.110.eng: the pupil should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.111.pli: Sace ācariyo mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.111.eng: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.112.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyaṃ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.112.eng: the pupil should try to get the Sangha to do it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.113.pli: Sace ācariyo mānattāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.113.eng: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves the trial period,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.114.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa mānattaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.114.eng: the pupil should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.115.pli: Sace ācariyo abbhānāraho hoti, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.115.eng: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.116.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyaṃ abbheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.116.eng: the pupil should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.117.pli: Sace saṅgho ācariyassa kammaṃ kattukāmo hoti, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.117.eng: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his teacher—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.118.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho ācariyassa kammaṃ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.118.eng: the pupil should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.119.pli: Kataṃ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṃ, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, antevāsikena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.119.eng: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his teacher—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.120.pli: kinti nu kho ācariyo sammā vatteyya, lomaṃ pāteyya, netthāraṃ vatteyya, saṅgho taṃ kammaṃ paṭippassambheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.120.eng: the pupil should help the teacher conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try to get the Sangha to lift that procedure.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.121.pli: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṃ dhovitabbaṃ hoti, antevāsikena dhovitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.121.eng: If the teacher’s robe needs washing, the pupil should do it himself,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.122.pli: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṃ dhoviyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.122.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.123.pli: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṃ kātabbaṃ hoti, antevāsikena kātabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.123.eng: If the teacher needs a robe, the pupil should make one himself,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.124.pli: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṃ kariyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.124.eng: or he should make an effort to get one made.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.125.pli: Sace ācariyassa rajanaṃ pacitabbaṃ hoti, antevāsikena pacitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.125.eng: If the teacher needs dye, the pupil should make it himself,
