pli-tv-kd18:12.11.126.pli: kinti nu kho ācariyassa rajanaṃ paciyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.126.eng: or he should make an effort to get it made.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.127.pli: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṃ rajitabbaṃ hoti, antevāsikena rajitabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.127.eng: If the teacher’s robe needs dyeing, the pupil should do it himself,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.128.pli: kinti nu kho ācariyassa cīvaraṃ rajiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.128.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.129.pli: Cīvaraṃ rajantena sādhukaṃ samparivattakaṃ samparivattakaṃ rajitabbaṃ, na ca acchinne theve pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.129.eng: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over, and shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.130.pli: Na ācariyaṃ anāpucchā ekaccassa patto dātabbo, na ekaccassa patto paṭiggahetabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.130.eng: Without asking his teacher for permission, he shouldn’t do any of the following: give away or receive a bowl;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.131.pli: na ekaccassa cīvaraṃ dātabbaṃ, na ekaccassa cīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.131.eng: give away or receive a robe;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.132.pli: na ekaccassa parikkhāro dātabbo, na ekaccassa parikkhāro paṭiggahetabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.132.eng: give away or receive a requisite;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.133.pli: na ekaccassa kesā cheditabbā, na ekaccena kesā chedāpetabbā;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.133.eng: cut anyone’s hair or get it cut;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.134.pli: na ekaccassa parikammaṃ kātabbaṃ, na ekaccena parikammaṃ kārāpetabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.134.eng: provide assistance to anyone or have assistance provided by anyone;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.135.pli: na ekaccassa veyyāvacco kātabbo, na ekaccena veyyāvacco kārāpetabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.135.eng: do a service for anyone or get a service done by anyone;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.136.pli: na ekaccassa pacchāsamaṇena hotabbaṃ, na ekacco pacchāsamaṇo ādātabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.136.eng: be the attendant monk for anyone or take anyone as his attendant monk;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.137.pli: na ekaccassa piṇḍapāto nīharitabbo, na ekaccena piṇḍapāto nīharāpetabbo;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.137.eng: bring back almsfood for anyone or get almsfood brought back by anyone;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.141.pli: Sace ācariyo gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.141.eng: If his teacher is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives or wait until he has recovered.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.142.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, antevāsikānaṃ ācariyesu vattaṃ yathā antevāsikehi ācariyesu sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.142.eng: This is the proper conduct of a pupil toward his teacher.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.143.0.eng: 14. Discussion of the proper conduct toward a pupil

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.143.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ācariyā antevāsikesu na sammā vattanti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.143.1.eng: At that time the teachers were not conducting themselves properly toward their pupils.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.144.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.144.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.145.pli: “kathañhi nāma ācariyā antevāsikesu na sammā vattissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.145.eng: “How can the teachers not conduct themselves properly toward their pupils?”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.146.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.147.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.147.eng: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.148.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, ācariyā antevāsikesu na sammā vattantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.148.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the teachers are not conducting themselves properly toward their pupils?”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.151.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.152.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, ācariyānaṃ antevāsikesu vattaṃ paññapessāmi yathā ācariyehi antevāsikesu sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.152.eng: “Well then, I’ll lay down the proper conduct for a teacher toward his pupil.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.153.eng: A teacher should conduct himself properly toward his pupil.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.155.pli: Ācariyena, bhikkhave, antevāsiko saṅgahetabbo anuggahetabbo uddesena paripucchāya ovādena anusāsaniyā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.155.eng: A teacher should help and take care of his pupil through recitation, questioning, and instruction.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.156.pli: Sace ācariyassa patto hoti, antevāsikassa patto na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa patto dātabbo, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.156.eng: If the teacher has a bowl, but not the pupil, the teacher should give it to him,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.157.pli: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa patto uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.157.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.158.pli: Sace ācariyassa cīvaraṃ hoti, antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ dātabbaṃ, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.158.eng: If the teacher has a robe, but not the pupil, the teacher should give it to him,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.159.pli: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.159.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.160.pli: Sace ācariyassa parikkhāro hoti, antevāsikassa parikkhāro na hoti, ācariyena antevāsikassa parikkhāro dātabbo, ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.160.eng: If the teacher has a requisite, but not the pupil, the teacher should give it to him,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.161.pli: kinti nu kho antevāsikassa parikkhāro uppajjiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.161.eng: or he should make an effort to get him one.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.162.1.pli: Sace antevāsiko gilāno hoti, kālasseva uṭṭhāya dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukhodakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.162.1.eng: “If the pupil is sick, the teacher should get up at the appropriate time and give his pupil a tooth cleaner and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.163.pli: Sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.163.eng: If there’s congee, he should rinse a vessel and bring the congee to his pupil.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.164.pli: Yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.164.eng: When he has drunk the congee, the teacher should give him water and receive the vessel. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.165.eng: When the pupil has gotten up, the teacher should put away the seat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.166.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.166.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.167.pli: Sace antevāsiko gāmaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, kāyabandhanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saguṇaṃ katvā saṅghāṭiyo dātabbā, dhovitvā patto sodako dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.167.eng: If the pupil wants to enter the village, the teacher should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should rinse his pupil’s bowl and give it to him while wet.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.168.pli: Ettāvatā nivattissatīti āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭinivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.168.eng: Before he’s due back, the teacher should prepare a seat and set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the pupil and receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.169.pli: Sace cīvaraṃ sinnaṃ hoti, muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbaṃ, na ca uṇhe cīvaraṃ nidahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.169.eng: If the robe is damp, he should sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.171.pli: Cīvaraṃ saṅgharantena caturaṅgulaṃ kaṇṇaṃ ussāretvā cīvaraṃ saṅgharitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.171.eng: offsetting the edges by seven centimeters,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.171.comm: That is, four aṅgula. See discussion under sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.172.eng: so that the fold doesn’t become worn.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.173.eng: He should place the belt in the fold.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.174.pli: Sace piṇḍapāto hoti, antevāsiko ca bhuñjitukāmo hoti, udakaṃ datvā piṇḍapāto upanāmetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.174.eng: If there’s almsfood and his pupil wants to eat, the teacher should give him water and then the almsfood.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.175.eng: He should ask his pupil if he wants water to drink.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.176.pli: Bhuttāvissa udakaṃ datvā pattaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā vodakaṃ katvā muhuttaṃ uṇhe otāpetabbo, na ca uṇhe patto nidahitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.176.eng: When the pupil has eaten, the teacher should give him water and receive his bowl. Holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.177.eng: The teacher should put away the robe and bowl.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.178.eng: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away. He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.179.eng: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.180.pli: pārato antaṃ orato bhogaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.180.eng: making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.181.pli: Antevāsikamhi uṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.181.eng: When the pupil has gotten up, the teacher should put away the seat and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.182.pli: Sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.182.eng: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.183.1.pli: Sace antevāsiko nahāyitukāmo hoti, nahānaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.183.1.eng: “If the pupil wants to bathe, the teacher should prepare a bath.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.184.pli: Sace sītena attho hoti, sītaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.184.eng: If he wants a cold bath, he should prepare that;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.185.pli: Sace uṇhena attho hoti, uṇhaṃ paṭiyādetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.185.eng: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.186.pli: Sace antevāsiko jantāgharaṃ pavisitukāmo hoti, cuṇṇaṃ sannetabbaṃ, mattikā temetabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya gantvā jantāgharapīṭhaṃ datvā cīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ, cuṇṇaṃ dātabbaṃ, mattikā dātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.186.eng: If the pupil wants to take a sauna, the teacher should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take a sauna bench, and go to the sauna. After giving his pupil the sauna bench, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.187.eng: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.188.pli: Jantāgharaṃ pavisantena mattikāya mukhaṃ makkhetvā purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharaṃ pavisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.188.eng: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself front and back, and then enter.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.189.eng: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.190.eng: or block the junior monks from getting a seat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.191.eng: While in the sauna, he should provide assistance to his pupil.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.192.pli: Jantāgharā nikkhamantena jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya purato ca pacchato ca paṭicchādetvā jantāgharā nikkhamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.192.eng: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna bench, cover himself front and back, and then leave.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.193.eng: The teacher should also provide assistance to his pupil in the water.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.194.pli: Nahātena paṭhamataraṃ uttaritvā attano gattaṃ vodakaṃ katvā nivāsetvā antevāsikassa gattato udakaṃ pamajjitabbaṃ, nivāsanaṃ dātabbaṃ, saṅghāṭi dātabbā, jantāgharapīṭhaṃ ādāya paṭhamataraṃ āgantvā āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, antevāsiko pānīyena pucchitabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.194.eng: When the teacher has bathed, he should be the first to come out. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his pupil’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna bench, he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, and also set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should ask his pupil if he wants water to drink.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.195.1.pli: Yasmiṃ vihāre antevāsiko viharati, sace so vihāro uklāpo hoti, sace ussahati, sodhetabbo.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.195.1.eng: “If the dwelling where the pupil is staying is dirty, the teacher should clean it if he’s able.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.196.pli: Vihāraṃ sodhentena paṭhamaṃ pattacīvaraṃ nīharitvā ekamantaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.196.eng: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside. He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside. He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside. Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside. Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside. He should take out the bed supports and put them aside. He should take out the spittoon and put it aside. He should take out the leaning board and put it aside. After taking note of its position, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside. If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room. If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls. If the floor has been treated with a black finish and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor. If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it, trying to avoid stirring up dust. He should look out for any trash and discard it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.197.eng: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back as before. He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before. He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before. He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back as before. He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before. He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back as before. He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was. He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was. He should put away the bowl and robe. When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away. He shouldn’t put the bowl away on the bare floor. When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.198.eng: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side. If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side. If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side. If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side. If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night. If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.199.eng: If the yard is dirty, he should sweep it. If the gateway is dirty, he should sweep it. If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it. If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it. If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it. If there’s no water for drinking, he should get some. If there’s no water for washing, he should get some.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.200.pli: ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ na hoti, ācamanakumbhiyā udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.200.eng: If there’s no water in the restroom ablutions pot, he should fill it.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.201.1.pli: Sace antevāsikassa anabhirati uppannā hoti, ācariyena vūpakāsetabbo, vūpakāsāpetabbo, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.201.1.eng: “If the pupil becomes discontent with the spiritual life, the teacher should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.202.pli: Sace antevāsikassa kukkuccaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, ācariyena vinodetabbaṃ, vinodāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.202.eng: If the pupil becomes anxious, the teacher should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.203.pli: Sace antevāsikassa diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti, ācariyena vivecetabbaṃ, vivecāpetabbaṃ, dhammakathā vāssa kātabbā.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.203.eng: If the pupil has wrong view, the teacher should make him give it up or have someone else do it, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.204.pli: Sace antevāsiko garudhammaṃ ajjhāpanno hoti, parivāsāraho, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.204.eng: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.205.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikassa parivāsaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.205.eng: the teacher should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.206.pli: Sace antevāsiko mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.206.eng: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.207.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikaṃ mūlāya paṭikasseyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.207.eng: the teacher should try to get the Sangha to do it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.208.pli: Sace antevāsiko mānattāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.208.eng: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves the trial period,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.209.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikassa mānattaṃ dadeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.209.eng: the teacher should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.210.pli: Sace antevāsiko abbhānāraho hoti, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.210.eng: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.211.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikaṃ abbheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.211.eng: the teacher should try to get the Sangha to give it to him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.212.pli: Sace saṅgho antevāsikassa kammaṃ kattukāmo hoti, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.212.eng: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his pupil—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.213.pli: kinti nu kho saṅgho antevāsikassa kammaṃ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.213.eng: the teacher should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.214.pli: Kataṃ vā panassa hoti, saṅghena kammaṃ, tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā, ācariyena ussukkaṃ kātabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.214.eng: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his pupil—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.215.pli: kinti nu kho antevāsiko sammā vatteyya, lomaṃ pāteyya, netthāraṃ vatteyya, saṅgho taṃ kammaṃ paṭippassambheyyāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.215.eng: the teacher should help the pupil conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try to get the Sangha to lift that procedure.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.216.pli: Sace antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ dhovitabbaṃ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—evaṃ dhoveyyāsīti,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.216.eng: If the pupil’s robe needs washing, the teacher should show him how to do it,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.217.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ dhoviyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.217.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.218.pli: Sace antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ kātabbaṃ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—evaṃ kareyyāsīti,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.218.eng: If the pupil needs a robe, the teacher should show him how to make one,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.219.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ kariyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.219.eng: or he should make an effort to get one made.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.220.pli: Sace antevāsikassa rajanaṃ pacitabbaṃ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—evaṃ paceyyāsīti,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.220.eng: If the pupil needs dye, the teacher should show him how to make it,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.221.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa rajanaṃ paciyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.221.eng: or he should make an effort to get it made.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.222.pli: Sace antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ rajitabbaṃ hoti, ācariyena ācikkhitabbaṃ—evaṃ rajeyyāsīti,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.222.eng: If the pupil’s robe needs dyeing, the teacher should show him how to do it,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.223.pli: ussukkaṃ vā kātabbaṃ—kinti nu kho antevāsikassa cīvaraṃ rajiyethāti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.223.eng: or he should make an effort to get it done.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.224.pli: Cīvaraṃ rajantena sādhukaṃ samparivattakaṃ samparivattakaṃ rajitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.224.eng: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.225.eng: and shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.226.pli: Sace antevāsiko gilāno hoti, yāvajīvaṃ upaṭṭhātabbo, vuṭṭhānamassa āgametabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.226.eng: If his pupil is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives or wait until he has recovered.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.227.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ācariyānaṃ antevāsikesu vattaṃ yathā ācariyehi antevāsikesu sammā vattitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.227.eng: This is the proper conduct of a teacher toward his pupil.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.228.pli: Vattakkhandhako aṭṭhamo. Imamhi khandhake vatthū ekūnavīsati, vattā cuddasa.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.228.eng: The eighth chapter on proper conduct is finished. In this chapter there are nineteen topics and fourteen kinds of proper conduct.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.232.eng: Would not bow down, they did not ask,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.234.eng: Removed, sunshade, and on the shoulder,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.241.eng: And occupied, where to go for alms.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.242.eng: Training, excrement, drinking water, washing water,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.245.eng: Should take out the floor cover.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.256.eng: From the east, and from the west,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.257.eng: From the north, then from the south.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.258.eng: And day and night in the cold and heat,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.264.eng: Laid down by the Incomparable one,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.265.eng: These make up the conduct for newly-arrived monks.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.267.eng: No going to meet, and no drinking water;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.268.eng: Would not bow down, would not assign,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.271.eng: And having gone to meet, drinking water;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.273.eng: And should bow down, should assign.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.274.eng: Occupied, and where to go for alms, training,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.277.eng: Remain seated for one who is junior.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.278.eng: Should bow down, should point out,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.281.eng: These make up the conduct for resident monks.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.284.eng: And they were lost, and unprotected,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.286.eng: Having put in order, having closed,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.289.eng: A monastery worker, a lay follower.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.291.eng: He should put away, and he should close;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.293.eng: And just so in a dry spot.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.295.eng: And just so in the open;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.296.eng: Hopefully the requisites will be okay,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.297.eng: The proper conduct for a departing monk.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.298.eng: They did not express their appreciation, by the most senior,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.299.eng: Left behind, by four or five;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.301.eng: These make up the conduct for the expression of appreciation.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.302.eng: The group of six were shabbily dressed,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.305.eng: In encroaching on the senior monks.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.306.eng: And the junior monks, upper robe,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.308.eng: Putting on the sarong while covering the navel and knees,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.314.eng: Hands on hips, covering the head, squatting on the heels,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.318.eng: And hands on hips, covering the head, clasping the knees,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.326.eng: Respectfully, and attention on the bowl,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.328.eng: Not from a heap, should cover,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.331.eng: The whole hand, he should not speak;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.336.eng: Licking the hand, the bowl, the lips,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.341.eng: Holding low, and on the ground.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.344.eng: Laid down by the King of the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.345.eng: This is the proper conduct in regard to dining halls.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.354.eng: Hands on hips, covering the head, squatting on the heels,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.358.eng: Or a vessel, and make wait,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.359.eng: Having lifted up, having stretched out;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.360.eng: He should receive, he should not look,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.362.eng: The monk should cover with the upper robe,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.367.eng: Hands on hips, covering the head, squatting on the heels.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.370.eng: The last may eat if he desires,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.374.eng: Hand signal, he should not break into speech,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.375.eng: This is the conduct for the alms collector.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.376.eng: Drinking water, washing water, fire, fire-making implements,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.378.eng: “None of it is,” having beaten up,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.379.eng: Bowl, on the shoulder, so robe.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.381.eng: Covering navel and knees, evenly all around;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.382.eng: As the conduct for the alms collector,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.383.eng: So the method for those staying in the wilderness.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.384.eng: Bowl, on the shoulder, robe, on the head,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.385.eng: And having put on, drinking water;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.387.eng: And also fire-making implements, walking stick.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.389.eng: Should be skilled also in the regions;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.390.eng: Laid down by the Supreme Teacher,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.390.comm: Reading satthuttamena with the PTS edition.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.391.eng: These make up the conduct for those staying in the wilderness.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.403.eng: And in an open area upwind.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.412.eng: And day and night in the cold and heat,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.416.eng: Restroom ablutions pot, and a senior monk,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.418.eng: Teaching, should turn off a lamp,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.419.eng: Should not open, and also not close.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.421.eng: Should not touch even with a corner;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.422.eng: Laid down by the Great Hero,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.423.eng: That is the proper conduct in regard to dwellings.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.426.eng: He should discard the ashes, sauna,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.427.eng: And just so the area outside.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.430.eng: Face, in front, not the senior monks,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.431.eng: Not the junior monks, if he is able.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.435.eng: These make up the conduct in regard to saunas.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.436.eng: He did not wash, according to seniority,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.441.eng: And pulled up, chomping, with remainder;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.442.eng: Outside, and inside, should clear his throat,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.450.eng: He should not leave, he should cover,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.455.eng: These make up the conduct in regard to restrooms.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.457.eng: And water for rinsing the mouth, seat;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.462.eng: Attendant, and the navel and the knees,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.465.eng: Not too far, he should receive;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.470.eng: He should sun, he left it, fold,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.471.eng: In the fold, to eat, should give.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.473.eng: A short while, and he should not leave it;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.476.eng: He should put away, and he should put away,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.482.eng: Front, the seniors, and the juniors,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.483.eng: And provide assistance, he should leave.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.484.eng: Front, in the water, when he has bathed,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.485.eng: Having put on the sarong, preceptor;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.490.eng: Dirty, he should clean it well,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.502.eng: From the east, and from the west,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.503.eng: From the north, then from the south.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.504.eng: And day and night in the cold and heat,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.507.eng: Restroom, water for drinking, water for washing.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.514.eng: He should wash, should make, and dye,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.521.eng: He should nurse for as long as he lives;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.523.eng: These make up the conduct for a preceptor.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.527.eng: He should not be the attendant.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.532.eng: The conduct concerning those newly arrived,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.534.eng: Those departing, and those expressing appreciation,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.535.eng: About the dining hall, about the alms collector.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.536.eng: The conduct for those staying in the wilderness,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.542.comm: It is not clear what the nineteen topics are and how they differ from the fourteen main headings mentioned just below. It is possible that the number nineteen comprises the fourteen sections plus some of the minor rules found in sections four, nine, and ten.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.543.eng: Fourteen on proper conduct in this chapter.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.544.eng: If you do not fulfill the proper conduct,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.545.eng: Then you do not fulfill your virtue;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.546.eng: Impure in virtue, weak in wisdom,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.547.eng: You do not know the unity of mind.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.549.eng: Does not see the teaching rightly;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.551.eng: You are not released from suffering.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.552.eng: But if you do fulfill the proper conduct,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.553.eng: Then you also fulfill your virtue;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.554.eng: Pure in virtue, possessed of wisdom,

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.555.eng: You also know the unity of mind.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.561.eng: You the Son of the Victor, possessed of insight;

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.562.eng: The instruction of the Buddha, the best—

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.563.eng: Go from that to extinguishment, in this way.”

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.564.eng: The chapter on proper conduct is finished.
